Questions: International Labour Organization(ILO) was established in …………..
solution: :The International Labour Organization (ILO) is a United Nations agency dealing with labour issues, particularly international labour standards, social protection, and work opportunities for all.The ILO has 186 member states: 185 of the 193 UN member states plus the Cook Islands are members of the ILO.

Questions: International Atomic Energy headquarters located at ……………..
solution: :The International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA) is an international organization that seeks to promote the peaceful use of nuclear energy, and to inhibit its use for any military purpose, including nuclear weapons. The IAEA was established as an autonomous organization on 29 July 1957.The IAEA reports to both the United Nations General Assembly and Security Council.The IAEA has its headquarters in Vienna.

Questions: FAO has …………………. member states
solution: :The Food and Agriculture Organization of the United Nations is an agency of the United Nations that leads international efforts to defeat hunger. FAO has 194 member states, Headquarters: Rome, Italy

Questions: North Atlantic Treaty Organization(NATO) was signed in 1949 at …………..
solution: :The North Atlantic Treaty Organization, also called the North Atlantic Alliance, is an intergovernmental military alliance based on the North Atlantic Treaty which was signed on 4 April 1949. Headquarters: Brussels, Belgium

Questions: South East  Asia Treaty Organizations(SEATO) was established in …………. having its headquarters at Bangkok
solution: :A SEATO conference in Manila. The Southeast Asia Treaty Organization (SEATO) was an international organization for collective defense inSoutheast Asia created by the Southeast Asia Collective Defense Treaty, or Manila Pact, signed in September 1954 in Manila, Philippines.

Questions: Where is the headquarters of  UNESCO ?
solution: :The United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations (UN). Its purpose is to contribute to peace and security by promoting international collaboration through education, science, and culture to further universal respect for justice, the rule of law, and human rights along with fundamental freedom proclaimed in the United Nations Charter. UNESCO has 195 member states and nine associate members. Most of its field offices are “cluster” offices covering three or more countries; national and regional offices also exist.

Questions: UNRWA(United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East) is established in …………………………
solution: :Created in December 1949, the United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East (UNRWA) is a relief and human development agency, originally intended to provide jobs on public works projects and direct relief for 652,000 Arab Palestinians who fled or were expelled from their homes during the fighting that followed the end of the British mandate over the region of Palestine.

Questions: The International Monetary Fund(IMF) is an international organization headquartered in
solution: :The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is an international organization headquartered in Washington, D.C., of “188 countries working to foster global monetary cooperation, secure financial stability, facilitate international trade, promote high employment and sustainable economic growth, and reduce poverty around the world Formed in 1944 at the Bretton Woods Conference, it came into formal existence in 1945 with 29 member countries and the goal of reconstructing the international payment system.

:The Universal Postal Union is a specialized agency of the United Nations that coordinates postal policies among member nations, in addition to the worldwide postal system. French is the official language of the UPU. English was added as a working language in 1994 Headquarters – Bern, Switzerland

Questions: ITU was formed in …………… at the International Telegraph Convention
solution: :ITU(International Telecommunication Union)was formed in 1865 at the International Telegraph Convention; this makes it one of the oldest intergovernmental organization in the world. ITU became a United Nations specialized agency in 1947. Headquarters: Geneva, Switzerland

Questions: International Development Association(IDA)is a member of the World Bank Group and is headquartered in …………………….
solution: :The International Development Association (IDA) is an international financial institution which offers concessional loans and grants to the world’s poorest developing countries. The IDA is a member of the World Bank Group and is headquartered in Washington, D.C., United States. It was established in 1960.

Questions: World Meteorological Organization was established in ………….
solution: :The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) is an intergovernmental organization with a membership of 191 Member States and Territories. It originated from the International Meteorological Organization (IMO), which was founded in 1873 . Established in 1950.It has its headquarters in Geneva, Switzerland.

Questions: IBRD  is an international financial institution that offers loans to middle-income developing countries.In that B mean
solution: :The International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD) is an international financial institution that offers loans to middle-income developing countries. The IBRD is the first of five member institutions that compose the World Bank Group and is headquartered in Washington, D.C., United States. It was established in 1944 .

Questions: The Group of 15(G-15) is …………………….
solution: :The Group of 15 (G-15) is an informal forum set up to foster cooperation and provide input for other international groups, such as the World Trade Organization and the Group of Eight. It was established at the Ninth Non-Aligned Movement Summit Meeting in Belgrade, Yugoslavia, in September 1989, and is composed of countries from Latin America, Africa, and Asia with a common goal of enhanced growth and prosperity.

Questions: UNICEF headquartered in …………………
solution: : The United Nations Children’s Education Fund (UNICEF) is a United Nations program headquartered in New York City that provides long-term humanitarian and developmental assistance to children and mothers in developing countries.UNICEF was created by the United Nations General Assembly on December 11, 1946.

Questions: UNEP is an agency that coordinates its environmental activities, assisting developing countries in implementing environmentally sound policies and practices. It was founded in ………….
solution: :United Nations Environment Programme (UNEP) is an agency that coordinates its environmental activities, assisting developing countries in implementing environmentally sound policies and practices. It was founded by Maurice Strong, its first director, as a result of the United Nations Conference on the Human Environment in June 1972 and has its headquarters in the Gigiri neighborhood of Nairobi, Kenya.

Questions: World Intellectual Property Organization(WIPO) is one of the 17specialized agencies of the United Nations and is headquartered in
solution: :The World Intellectual Property Organization (WIPO) is one of the 17 specialized agencies of the United Nations.WIPO was created in 1967 .WIPO currently has 188 member states, administers 26 international treaties and is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland.

Questions: The International Organization for Standardization(ISO) is Founded in
solution: :The International Organization for Standardization (ISO) is an international standard-setting body composed of representatives from various national standards organizations.Founded on 23 February 1947.It is headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland.

Questions: The colour combination of UN-Flag is ……………..
solution: :The flag of the United Nations was adopted on December 7, 1946, and consists of the official emblem of the United Nations in white on a blue background.

Questions: ……………………. is a specialized agency of the United Nations dedicated to eradicating rural poverty in developing countries
solution: :The International Fund for Agricultural Development (IFAD) is a specialized agency of the United Nations dedicated to eradicating rural poverty in developing countries. It was established as an international financial institution in 1977 Its headquarters is in Rome, Italy, and is a member of the United Nations Development Group.

Questions: The International Court of Justice (ICJ) is the principal judicial organ of the United Nations (UN). The seat of the Court is at the Peace Palace in …………………..
solution: :The International Court of Justice (ICJ) is the principal judicial organ of the United Nations (UN). It was established in June 1945 by the Charter of the United Nations and began work in April 1946. The seat of the Court is at the Peace Palace in The Hague (Netherlands).

Questions: Which of the following headquarters located in the Quartier International of Montreal, Canada ?
solution: :The International Civil Aviation Organization (ICAO) is a specialized agency of the United Nations. It codifies the principles and techniques of international air navigation and fosters the planning and development of international air transport to ensure safe and orderly growth.Its headquarters are located in the Quartier International of Montreal, Canada.

Questions: The International Olympic Committee is formed in …………….
solution: :The International Olympic Committee is an international, non-profit, non-governmental organization based in Lausanne, Switzerland, created by Pierre de Coubertin, on 23 June 1894 .

Questions: United Nations World Tourism Organization headquarters are located in ……………..
solution: :The United Nations World Tourism Organization (UNWTO) is the United Nations agency responsible for the promotion of responsible, sustainable and universally accessible tourism. Its headquarters are located in Madrid, Spain.It was formed in 1957.

Questions: Which of the following is not a member of  GCC ?
solution: :The Cooperation Council for the Arab States of the Gulf known as the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) is a regional intergovernmental political and economic union consisting of all Arab states of the Persian Gulf, except for Iraq. Its member states are  Bahrain,  Kuwait, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, and the United Arab Emirates.Its HQ in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia

Questions: The Non-Aligned Movement(NAM) was founded in Belgrade in ……………..
solution: :The Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) is a group of states which are not formally aligned with or against any major power bloc. As of 2012, the movement has 120 members. The organization was founded in Belgrade in 196A)

Questions: The Indian Ocean Commission(IOC) is ……………………
solution: :The Indian Ocean Commission (IOC) is an intergovernmental organization that was created in 1982 at Port Louis, Mauritius and institutionalized in 1984 by the Victoria Agreement in Seychelles. The IOC is composed of five African Indian Ocean nations: Comoros,Réunion (a department of FrancE), Madagascar, Mauritius and Seychelles.

Questions: Which of the following is member of European Free Trade Association (EFTA) ?
solution: :The European Free Trade Association (EFTA) is a common market consisting of four European countries that operates in parallel with and is linked to the European Union (EU)The EFTA was established on 3 May 1960 as a trade bloc-alternative for European states.HQ – Geneva, Switzerland. Members are Iceland, Liechtenstein, Norway, and Switzerland

Questions: The International Rescue Committee(IRC) was Founded in ………………
solution: :The International Rescue Committee (IRC) is a global humanitarian aid,relief and development  non governmental organization. Founded in 1933 at the request of Albert Einstein, the IRC offers emergency aid and long-term assistance to refugees and those displaced by war, persecution or natural disaster.Its headquarters located in New York, USA

Questions: The United Nations Atomic Energy Commission (UNAEC) was founded on 24 January 1946 by ……………….. of the United Nations General Assembly resolution
solution: :The United Nations Atomic Energy Commission (UNAEC) was founded on 24 January 1946 by Resolution 1 of the United Nations General Assembly resolution “to deal with the problems raised by the discovery of atomic energy. HQ – New York, USA

Questions: Wide Fund for Nature is an international non-governmental organization founded on April 29, 1961, its headquarters in ………….
solution: :The World Wide Fund for Nature is an international non-governmental organization founded on April 29, 1961, working in the field of the biodiversity conservation, and the reduction of humanity’s footprint on the environment. Headquarters: Gland, Switzerland

Questions: The G-20 was founded in ………………..
solution: :The G-20 was founded in 1999. The Group of Twenty is an international forum for the governments and central bank governors from 20 major economies.

Questions: Which of the following country is not included in G-20 forum ?
solution: :The members include 19 individual countries Argentina, Australia, Brazil, Canada, China,France, Germany, India, Indonesia, Italy, Japan, South Korea, Mexico, Russia, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, Turkey, the United Kingdom and the United States—along with the European Union (EU).

Questions: International Hockey Federation is commonly known by the acronym FIH headquarters are located in …………………….
solution: :International Hockey Federation is commonly known by the acronym FIH is the international governing body of field hockey and indoor field hockey. Its headquarters are located in Lausanne, Switzerland

Questions: How many countries are included in the Peace and Security Council ?
solution: :The Peace and Security Council is the organ of the African Union in charge of enforcing union decisions. It is patterned somewhat after the United Nations Security Council.It consist of 15 countries as its member. HQ – Addis Ababa

Questions: Which country is recently suspended from G-8 forum ?
solution: :The Group of Eight (currently known as Group of Seven) is a governmental political forum. It was originally formed by six leading industrial countries and subsequently extended with two additional members – one of which, Russia, has been suspended.Since 2014 in effect it comprises seven nations and the European Union.

Questions: The Asian Football Confederation(AFC) is the governing body of association football in ……………………..
solution: :The Asian Football Confederation (AFC) is the governing body of association football in Asia and Australia. It has 47 member countries, mostly located on the Asian and Australian continent but excluding all the transcontinental countries with territory in both Europe and Asia, which are members of UEFA Headquarters- Kuala Lumpur,Malaysia

Questions: The Bank for International Settlements(BIS) is an international company limited by shares owned by central banks.Its HQ located in
solution: :The Bank for International Settlements is an international company limited by shares owned by central banks which “fosters international monetary and financial cooperation and serves as a bank for central banks” Headquarters: Basel, Switzerland

Questions: The International Tennis Federation (ITF) is the governing body of world tennis,its headquarters in
solution: : The International Tennis Federation (ITF) is the governing body of world tennis, made up of 210 national tennis associations or corresponding organizations of independent countries or territories Headquarters-London, England, UK

Questions: Which country is included in the G – 7 forum ?
solution: :The Group of 7 (G7) is a group consisting of Canada, France, Germany, Italy, Japan, the United Kingdom, and the United States. The European Union is also represented within the G7. These countries are the seven major advanced economies as reported by the International Monetary Fund

Questions: Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons(OPCW) is an intergovernmental organisation, located in……………….
solution: :The Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons (OPCW) is an intergovernmental organisation, located in The Hague,Netherlands.

Questions: World Toilet Organization was established in the year ………………………
solution: :The World Toilet Organization is a global non-profit organization committed to improving toilet and sanitation conditions worldwide. Headquarters: Singapore

Questions: International Centre for Migration Policy Development(ICMPD) headquarters are located in ……………….
solution: :The International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD) was established by Austria and Switzerland in 1993 and has since grown to 14 member states. ICMPD was founded to carry out research, projects and activities on migration-related issues

Questions: International Centre for Migration Policy Development(ICMPD) was established in
solution: :The International Centre for Migration Policy Development (ICMPD) was established by Austria and Switzerland in 1993 and has since grown to 14 member states. ICMPD was founded to carry out research, projects and activities on migration-related issues

Correct: – C)International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies
OptionA: International Centre for Migration Policy Development
OptionC: International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies
Questions: Which of the following headquarters located in Geneva ?
solution: :The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies reaches 160 million people each year through its 190-member National Societies. HQ – Geneva, Switzerland

Questions: Antarctic Treaty System is established in ……………………
solution: :The Antarctic Treaty System is the whole complex of arrangements made for the purpose of regulating relations among states in the Antarctic.

Questions: Intergovernmental Authority on Development(IGAD) headquarters located in
solution: :The Intergovernmental Authority on Development (IGAD) is an eight-country trade bloc in Africa. It includes governments from the Horn of Africa, Nile Valley, and the African Great Lakes. Its headquarters are in Djibouti City.

Questions: Commonwealth Games Federation(CGF) is established in
solution: :The Commonwealth Games Federation (CGF) is the international organisation responsible for the direction and control of the Commonwealth Games, and is the foremost authority in matters relating to the games. Headquarters-London, England, United Kingdom

Questions: International Paralympic Committee headquarters located in ………………..
solution: :The International Paralympic Committee is an international non-profit organisation and the global governing body for the Paralympic Movement. Headquarters: Bonn, Germany

Questions: International Cricket Council(ICC) is established in …………………..
solution: :The International Cricket Council (ICC) is the international governing body of cricket. It was founded as the Imperial Cricket Conference in 1909 by representatives from England, Australia and South Africa, renamed the International Cricket Conferencein 1965 HQ – UAE

Questions: Which of the following is not the member of OPEC ?
solution: :OPEC(Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries) has 13 members namely: Algeria, Angola, Ecuador,Indonesia, Iran, Iraq, Kuwait, Libya, Nigeria, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, United Arab Emirates and Venezuela. HQ : Vienna, Austria

Questions: SAARC was formed by seven states in ……………………….
solution: :SAARC was founded by seven states in 1985 .South Asian Association for Regional Cooperation (SAARC) is an  economic  and  geopolitical organisation of eight countries that are primarily located in  South Asia or the Indian subcontinent.The SAARC Secretariat is based in Kathmandu, Nepal.The combined economy of SAARC is the 3rd largest in the world in the terms of GDP(PPP) after the United States and China Member states: Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, India, Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, and Sri Lanka.

Questions: How many countries are member of the United Nations ?
solution: :The UN officially came into existence on 24 October 1945, after ratification of the United Nations Charter by the five permanentmembers of the United Nations Security Council (the Republic of China, France, the Soviet Union, the United Kingdom, and theUnited States) and a majority of the other signatories. There are currently 193 Member States of the United Nations. The latest State to join the United Nations was Montenegro in 2006.

Questions: Which of the following country is not a permanent member of UN Security Council ?
solution: :The permanent members of the United Nations Security Council, also known as thenPermanent Five, Big Five, or P5, include the following five governments: China, France, Russia, the United Kingdom, and the United States.

Questions: UN security council founded on  …………………..
solution: :The United Nations Security Council (UNSC) is one of the six principal organs of the United Nations and is charged with the maintenance of international peace and security as well as accepting new members to the United Nations and approving any changes to its United Nations Charter. HQ: New York, US

Questions: The European Union is a politico'clear Lock' -e 'keycode 0x42 = Escape'conomic union of …………………member states that are located primarily in Europe.
solution: :The European Union is a politico'clear Lock' -e 'keycode 0x42 = Escape'conomic union of 28 member states that are located primarily in Europe. Founded on November 1, 1993, HQ: City of Brussels, Belgium

Questions: BRICS was originally known as …………before the inclusion of South Africa in 2010.
solution: :BRICS is the acronym for an association of five major emerging national economies: Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa.The grouping was originally known as BRIC before the inclusion of South Africa in 2010.

Questions: World Trade Organization headquarters located in ……………………..
solution: :HQ: Geneva, Switzerland The World Trade Organization (WTO) is an intergovernmental organization which regulates international trade. The WTO officially commenced on 1 January 1995 under the Marrakesh Agreement, signed by 123 nations on 15 April 1994, replacing the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT), which commenced in 1948.

Questions: World Trade Organization was earlier known as …………………
solution: :The WTO officially commenced on 1 January 1995 replacing the General Agreement on Tariffs and Trade (GATT), which commenced in 1948

Questions: The World Health Organization was established in ……………
solution: :The World Health Organization is a specialized agency of the United Nations (UN) that is concerned with international public health. It was established on 7 April 1948, headquartered in Geneva, Switzerland. The WHO is a member of the United Nations Development Group.

Questions: Rajaji Tiger Reserve is located in which state ?
solution: :Rajaji Tiger Reserve (earlier Rajaji National Park) is located in the Shivalik range of Himalayas and spread over 820 kms. It covers a part of over three districts of Uttarakhand: Haridwar, Dehradun and Pauri Garhwal

Questions: The Dudhwa Tiger Reserve is a protected area in
solution: :The Dudhwa Tiger Reserve is a protected area in Uttar Pradesh that stretches mainly across the Lakhimpur Kheri and Bahraich districts and comprises the Dudhwa National Park, Kishanpur Wildlife Sanctuary and Katarniaghat Wildlife Sanctuary

Questions: The Tiger reserve located in Tamil Nadu is
solution: :Sathyamangalam Tiger Reserve is a protected area and tiger reserve along the Western Ghats in the Indian state of Tamil Nadu.

Questions: Ranthambore Tiger Reserve lies in which state of India ?
solution: :Ranthambore Tiger Reserve lies in the eastern part of Rajasthan state in Karauli and Sawai Madhopur districts.

Questions: Pench Tiger Reserve is located in which of the following state ?
solution: :Pench National Park or Tiger Reserve is one of the premier tiger reserves of India and the only one to straddle across two states – Madhya Pradesh and  Maharashtra .

Questions: Kanha Tiger Reserve is situated in
solution: :Kanha Tiger Reserve, also called Kanha National Park, is one of the tiger reserves of India and the largest national park of Madhya Pradesh

Questions: Parambikulam Tiger Reserve is in …………..
solution: :Parambikulam Tiger Reserve, which also includes the erstwhile Parambikulam Wildlife Sanctuary, is a 391 square kilometres protected area in Chittur taluk in Palakkad district of Kerala state .

Questions: Which Tiger reserve is located in Karnataka ?
solution: :Nagarhole National Park also known as Rajiv Gandhi National Park is also a tiger reserve . The park is located in Karnataka .

Questions: Indravati Tiger Reserves is located in which state ?
solution: :Indravati Tiger Reserves is a Tiger Reserve area in Chhattisgarh

Questions: Orang national park is in
solution: :Assam’s Orang national park, a postcard-size protected area about 150 km from here, has been declared as the tiger reserve

The first female president of our country was ……………………….
solution: :Prathiba Patil was the 12thPresident of India from 2007 to 2012 . She previously served as the Governor of Rajasthan from 2004 to 2007.

Questions: Who among the following was the first Chief justice of India ?
solution: :Sir Harilal Jekisundas Kania was the first Chief Justice of India, dying in office in 1951 .

Questions: The first President of India was …………………….
solution: :Rajendra Prasad was the first President of the Republic of India. Succeeded by Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan

Questions: Who among the following was the first female Prime minister of India?
solution: :Indira Priyadarshini Gandhi was the first female Prime Minister of India and central figure of the Indian National Congress party

Questions: The first chairman of Finance Commission of  India was …………………..
solution: :Kshitish Chandra Neogy also known as KC Neogy, was an Indian politician from West Bengal. He was a member of the Constituent Assembly of India, member of the first cabinet of independent India and the chairman of the first Finance Commission of India.

Questions: ……………………………. was the first female judge in Supreme Court of India
solution: :Justice Fathima Beevi was the first female judge of the Supreme Court of India whose tenure lasted from October 6 1989 to April 29, 1992 . The second was Justice Sujata V Manohar.

Questions: Who was elected as the first Vice-President of India ?
solution: :Sarvepalli Radhakrishnan was the first Vice President of India and the second President of India from 1962 to 1967

Questions: ………………. is the first chief election commissioner of our country
solution: :Sukumar Sen  was an Indian civil servant who was the first Chief Election Commissioner of India, serving from 21 March 1950 to 19 December 1958.

Questions: The first female chief minister of India was …………………….
solution: :Sucheta Kriplani was an Indian freedom fighter and politician. She was India’s first woman Chief Minister, serving as the head of the Uttar Pradesh government from 1963 to 1967.

Questions: Who was elected as the first Prime minister of India ?
solution: :Jawaharlal Nehru was the first Prime Minister of India and a central figure in Indian politics before and after independence.Born in November 14, 1889.Nov 14 is celebrated as Childrens day.

Questions: Which of the following is the highest lake in India  ?
solution: :The highest lake in India is Devatal located at a height of 17745ft in Garhwal Himalayas

Questions: The Largest Museum India Museum is located in …………………………
solution: :Indian Museum in Kolkata is the largest museum in India. It is the ninth oldest regular museum of the world and oldest institution of its kind in Asia Pacific region. Indian Museum is a multipurpose and multi disciplinary institution of national importance. The museum was established at the Asiatic Society, the earliest learned body in the country on 2nd February 1814 . Dr. Nathaniel Wallich, a Danish botanist, was the founder curator of the museum.

Questions: India’s Largest Canal ………………………….  is located in Rajasthan
solution: :The Indira Gandhi Canal is one of the largest canal projects in India. It starts from the Harike Barrage at Firozpur, a few kilometers below the confluence of the Satluj and Beas rivers in the Indian state of Punjab and terminates in irrigation facilities in the Thar Desert in the north west of Rajasthan state.

Questions: Which of the following is the highest peak in India ?
solution: :Kangchenjunga is the highest mountain peak.K2 lies in Pakistan near the Pakistan-China border. The Kanchenjunga lies partly in Sikkim and partly in Nepal.

Questions: Mahatma Gandhi Setu is the longest river bridge in India.It was located in …………….
solution: :Mahatma Gandhi Setu is a bridge over the river Ganges connecting Patna in the south to Hajipur in the north of Bihar. Its length is 5 .8km and it is one of the longest river bridges in India

Questions: ……………………………. is the Largest Zoo in India
solution: :The Alipore Zoological Garden is India’s oldest formally stated zoological and a big tourist attraction in Kolkata, West Bengal. It has been open as a zoo since 1876, and covers 18.81 ha (46.5 acres).

Questions: Which of the following state has the lowest population ?
solution: :Sikkim – 48.90% of the country’s population lives in five States, namely, Uttar Pradesh, Maharashtra,Bihar, West Bengal and Andhra Pradesh. Ten most populated states of India contributes 76.56% of India’s population.

Questions: …………………..  is the largest state in terms of Area
solution: :Rajasthan -342,240km Rajasthan is India’s largest state by area(342,239 square kilometres (132,139 sq mi) or 10.4% of India’s total areA). It is located on the western side of the country, where it comprises most of the wide and inhospitable Thar Desert (also known as the “Rajasthan Desert” and “Great Indian Desert”) and shares a border with the Pakistani provinces of Punjab to the northwest and Sindh to the west, along the Sutlej-Indus river valley.

Questions: ……………………………… is the longest road in India
solution: :The Grand Trunk Road is one of Asia’s oldest and longest major roads. For more than two millennia, it has linked the eastern and western regions of the Indian subcontinent, connecting South Asia with Central Asia. It runs from Chittagong, Bangladesh west to Howrah, West Bengal in India, running across Northern India into Lahore in Pakistan, further up to Kabul in Afghanistan.It was built by Sher Shah Suri

Questions: Which of the following is the tallest statue in India ?
solution: :The proposed height of India’s tallest Hanuman statue is 176 feet and is expected to be completed by the year 2015 . Most statues of Hindu gods like Hanuman and Shiva, and a few Buddhist statues in India are as high as 100 feet

Questions: Which of the bank in India with largest number of branches ?
solution: :State Bank of India (SBI), the country’s largest lender, has the highest number of branches running from rented facilities among public sector banks – 16,333 branches.

Questions: ………………………. is the longest corridor in India
solution: :Ramanathaswamy corridor(1220 mt) is a Hindu temple dedicated to god Shiva located on Rameswaram island in the state of Tamil Nadu, India. It is also one of the twelve Jyothirlinga temples, where Shiva is worshipped in the form of a Jyotirlingam (English: pillar of light)

Questions: Which of the following is the largest man made lake in India?
solution: :Govind Vallabh Pant Sagar is a man made lake situated in southern region of Sonebhadra named after Bharat Ratna Pandit Govind Ballabh Pant Chief minister of United Provinces present day Uttar Pradesh (September 10, 1887 – March 7, 1961) was a statesman of India.

Questions: ……………………… is the biggest Mosque in India
solution: :Jama Masjid in New Delhi, overlooking Chandni Chowk and the Red Fort, is the largest mosque in India. The mosque was built by Mughal emperor Shahjahan in 1656. It has typical Mughal architecture with three gateways, four towers and two minarets. The Jama Masjid is made up of red sandstone and white marble. It contain 260 pillars.

Questions: Which of the following is the highest tower in India?
solution: :The Fateh Burj is the tallest minar in India situated in the historical village of Chappar Chiri in the SAS Nagar district, Punjab.The 328 ft tower is dedicated to establishment of the Sikh Misls in a large part of India in 1711

Questions: ………………. is the largest church in India ?
solution: :Se Cathedral in Old Goa is the largest church in India. The original building was constructed of mud and stones and straw and was erected in 1510 and was dedicated to St. Catherine. In 1538 the church status was elevated to that of a Cathedral with the establishment of the Diocese of Goa. The Cathedral as it stands today took 90 years to be completed.

Questions: Which of the following is the largest Gurudwara ?
solution: :Golden Temple in Amritsar is the largest Gurudwara in India. In fact, Golden Temple is the largest Gurudwara in the world. Golden Temple is also known as Harminder Sahib and is considered to be the most sacred shrine of Sikhs

Questions: …………….. is the largest Hotel in India ?

solution: :The Kayang Mala dance is one of the most popular dance in Himachal. In this, the dancers are dressed in their traditional finery, weave their arms together to form a sort of a criss cross pattern in order to appear like beads in a woven garland.

Questions: Lai Haroba is a dance related to which state ?
solution: :Lai Haraoba is a Manipuri festival, and is associated with Meiteis, celebrated to please traditional deities.Celebrated in honour of the sylvan deities known as Umang Lai,the festival represents the worship of traditional deities and ancestors.

Questions: ______ is a famous dance in West Bengal
solution: :The folk dance/theater of Gambhira originated among the Hindu community of Maldah in West Bengal. After Partition of India, Chapai Nawabganj in Rajshahi became the main center of Gambhira

Questions: Which dance is the popular folk dance of Bihar ?
solution: :Bidesia dance is the most popular folk dance of Bihar.

Questions: ______ is a popular dance of North India
solution: :Kathak is a type of northern Indian classical dance, with alternating passages of mime and dancing.

Questions: Mohiniattam is a solo dance form from ______.
solution: :Mohiniyattam is a classical dance form from Kerala, India. Believed to have originated in 16th century CE,  it is one of the eight Indian classical dance forms recognized by the Sangeet Natak Akademi.

solution: :Sound waves or audible waves ľ 20Hz to 20000Hz These waves sensitive to human ear

solution: :Speed of sound is maximum in solids and minimum in gases

solution: :Frequency is defined as the no of oscillations in 1 seconds Frequency Unit ľ Hertz F=1/T

Questions: The echo is not heared at the _____. due to absence of atmosphere
solution: :The sound waves received after being reflected from some other place is called echo. The minimum distance between the observer and reflector should be 17m.

solution: :Transverse waves are always characterized by particle motion being perpendicular to wave motion.

solution: :Distance between consecutive trough or compression is known as Wavelength Wavelength( ?) Unit ľ meter

Questions: Who introduced the concept of inertia ?
solution: :The term ôinertiaö is more properly understood as shorthand for ôthe principle of inertiaö as described by Newton in his First Law of Motion: that an object not subject to any net external force moves at a constant velocity.

Questions: If the resultant of all the force acting on a body is _____. then the body is said to be in equilibrium
solution: :Equilibrium results from the cancellation of forces acting on an object.

Questions: Rocket works on the principle of _____
solution: :Conservation of momentum is a fundamental law of physics which states that the momentum of a system is constant if there are no external forces acting on the system. It is embodied in Newtonĺs first law (the law of inertiA).

Questions: If the body is at rest then the equilibrium is called as _____
solution: :When forces acting on an object which is at rest are balanced, then we say that the object is in a state of static equilibrium. The resultant of these forces equals zero. That is, the vector sum of the forces adds to zero

Questions: Energy is defined as capacity of doing work.Its unit is _____.
solution: :The joule symbol J, is a derived unit of energy in the International System of Units. It is equal to the energy transferred (or work donE) to an object when a force of one newton acts on that object in the direction of its motion through a distance of one metre (1 newton metre or N)

Questions: A bullet fired from a gun can pierce a target due to its _____
solution: :Kinetic energy is the energy possessed by a body by virtue of its motion KE = Ż(mv2)

Questions: _____ is the energy possessed by a body by virtue of its position
solution: :Potential Energy is the energy possessed by a body by virtue of its position. Ex ľ The potential energy of water in dams used to run turbines inorder to produce electricity.

Questions: The sum of all kinds of energies in an isolated system remains _____.. at all times
solution: :According to law of conservation of energy the sum of all kinds of energies in an isolated system remains constant at all time.

Questions: In a heat engine _____.. energy changes into _____. energy
solution: :In a heat engine Heat energy changes into Mechanical energy

Questions: In electric motor _____.. energy changes into _____. energy
solution: :In electric motor electrical energy changes into mechanical energy

Questions: The normal temperature of human body is _____.
solution: :Normal body temperature as an oral temperature of 98.6░F (37░C). This is an average of normal body temperatures.

Questions: Density of water is maximum at _____..
solution: :Density of a substance is defined as the ratio of its mass to its volume Unit = kg/m3

Questions: What is the SI unit of pressure ?
solution: :Pressure is defined as the force acting normally on unit area of the surface Unit = N/m2  or Pascal.A tmospheric pressure is measured by Barometer

Questions: Slow fall in barometric reading is the indication of _____.
solution: :The slow fall in barometric reading is the indication of rain The slow rise in barometric reading is the indication of clear weather The sudden fall in barometric reading is the indication of storm

Questions: The angle of contact is _____. for pure water and clean glass
solution: :The angle of contact is 00 for pure water and clean glass. It is 900 for silver, 80  for ordinary water and 1350 for mercury

Questions: Which does not require the medium for their propagation ?
solution: :Electromagnetic waves do not require medium for their propagation. Ex ľ Cathode rays, Alpha and Beta rays

Questions: Which require the medium for their propagation ?
The speed of Supersonic wave is measured in _____.
solution: :Mach number is the ratio of speed of source to the speed of sound Mach number >1- Supersonic Mach number >5- Hypersonic Mach number <1 ľ Body is moving with supersonic

Questions: Pyrometer canĺt measure the temperature below _____
solution: :Pyrometer measure the temperature of a body by measuring the radiation emitted by the body.It canĺt measure the temperature below 800 0C

Questions: Freezing point of Mercury _____.
solution: :Freezing point of Mercury is 390C.To measure the temperature below -390C alcohol thermometer is used. Freezing point of alcohol is -1140C

Questions: All planets move around the sun in elliptical orbits having the sun at one foci of the orbit is called _____.
solution: :All planets move around the sun in elliptical orbits having the sun at one foci of the orbit is called ľ Keplerĺs law

Questions: The earth rotates on its axis from _____..
solution: :The earth rotates on its axis from west to east. This rotation makes the sun and the stars appear to be moving across from East to West.

Questions: Escape velocity is _____.. times the orbital velocity
solution: :Escape velocity is Escape velocity is  .v2 times the orbital velocity times the orbital velocity.Escape velocity is the minimum speed needed for an object to ôbreak freeö from the gravitational attraction of a massive body. The escape velocity from Earth is about 40,270 km/h

Questions: If strain is longitudinal then the modulus of elasticity is called ,_____.
solution: :Youngĺs modulus, which is also known as the elastic modulus, is a mechanical property of linear elastic solid materials. It defines the relationship between stress (force per unit areA) and strain (proportional deformation) in a material

Questions: The amount of heat given to the system is used up in 2 ways is _____
solution: :First law of Thermodynamics ľ the amount of heat given to the system is used up in 2 ways, first to increase the internal energy and second to do the external work

Questions: Mercury has _____.. Specific heat
solution: :Mercury has low Specific heat.The specific heat is the amount of heat per unit mass required to raise the temperature by one degree Celsius.

Questions: The _____. law of thermodynamics is the outcome of human experience under which heat energy can be converted
solution: :The Second law of Thermodynamics is the outcome of human experience under which heat energy can be converted into mechanical energy

Questions: Linear expansion mean _____
solution: :Linear expansion means change in one dimension (length) as opposed to change in volume (volumetric expansion).

Questions: Expansion in area is called _____
solution: :Expansion in area is called Superficial Expansion

Questions: A steel block with a volume of _____.might expand to A)002 cubic meters when the temperature is raised by 50 K.
solution: :The volume of a material changes by some fixed fractional amount. For example, a steel block with a volume of 1 cubic meter might expand to A)002 cubic meters when the temperature is raised by 50 K.

Questions: Which is used to measure altitudes and also used in aircrafts ?
solution: :An altimeter or an altitude meter is an instrument used to measure the altitude of an object above a fixed level. The measurement of altitude is called altimetry.

Questions: _____.measures the emission of Radiant Energy
solution: :A radiometer or roentgenometer is a device for measuring the radiant flux (power) of electromagnetic radiation. Generally, a radiometer is an infrared radiation detector or ultraviolet detector.

Questions: Dynamo converts _____ into _____
solution: :A dynamo is a device that converts mechanical energy into electrical energy

Questions: Which of the following measures the quantity of heat ?
solution: :A calorimeter is an object used for calorimetry, or the process of measuring the heat of chemical reactions or physical changes as well as heat capacity.

Questions: Manometer measures the _____..
solution: :A manometer is an instrument that uses a column of liquid to measure pressure, although the term is currently often used to mean any pressure measuring instrument.

Questions: Which instrument is used to determine the purity of milk ?
solution: :An instrument for estimating the purity or richness of milk, as a measuring glass, a specific gravity bulb, or other apparatus.

Questions: _____ measures the electrical potential difference between two points
solution: :A voltmeter is an instrument used for measuring electrical potential difference between two points in an electric circuit. Analog voltmeters move a pointer across a scale in proportion to the voltage of the circuit.

Questions: Which instrument is used in measuring speeds of aeroplane and motor boats ?
solution: :A tachometer is an instrument measuring the rotation speed of a shaft or disk, as in a motor or other machine. The device usually displays the revolutions per minute (RPM) on a calibrated analogue dial, but digital displays are increasingly common.

Questions: Hydrometer measures the _____
solution: :A hydrometer is an instrument that measures the specific gravity (relative density) of liquidsŚthe ratio of the density of the liquid to the density of water.A hydrometer is usually made of glass, and consists of a cylindrical stem and a bulb weighted with mercury or lead shot to make it float upright.

Questions: _____. measures the intensity of earthquake shocks
solution: :Seismometers are instruments that measure motion of the ground, including those of seismic waves generated by earthquakes, volcanic eruptions, and other seismic sources. Records of seismic waves allow seismologists to map the interior of the Earth, and locate and measure the size of these different sources.

Questions: Which is used to measures strength of electric current ?
solution: :An ammeter is a measuring instrument used to measure the current in a circuit. Electric currents are measured in amperes

Questions: Dynamometer is used to measures _____
solution: :A dynamometer or ôdynoö for short, is a device for measuring force, torque, or power. For example, the power produced by an engine, motor .

Questions: Which is used to measures sound under water ?
solution: :A hydrophone  is a microphone designed to be used underwater for recording or listening to underwater sound. Most hydrophones are based on a piezoelectric transducer that generates electricity when subjected to a pressure change.

Questions: _____.. is an instrument for producing sound
solution: :The phonograph is a device invented in 1877 for the mechanical recording and reproduction of sound. In its later forms it is also called a gramophone

Questions: Speedometer is used to _____.
solution: :A speedometer or a speed meter is a gauge that measures and displays the instantaneous speed of a vehicle.

Questions: _____.. is used to obtain magnified view of small objects
solution: :Microscope is an optical instrument used for viewing very small objects, such as mineral samples or animal or plant cells, typically magnified several hundred times.

Questions: Audiometer measures _____..
solution: :Audiometer is an instrument for gauging and recording acuity of hearing also measures the Intensity of Sound

Questions: Which is used to detects presence of electric charge ?
solution: :An electroscope is an early scientific instrument that is used to detect the presence and magnitude of electric charge on a body. It was the first electrical measuring instrument. The first electroscope, a pivoted needle called the versorium, was invented by British physician William Gilbert around 1600.

Questions: Salinometer determines _____.. of solution
solution: :A salinometer is a device designed to measure the salinity, or dissolved salt content, of a solution

Questions: _____.. is used for the measurement of temperature
solution: :A thermometer is a device that measures temperature or a temperature gradient. A thermometer has two important elements: (1) a temperature sensor, (2) some means of converting this physical change into a numerical value

Questions: Which is used to measures the power of an electric circuit ?
solution: :The wattmeter is an instrument for measuring the electric power (or the supply rate of electrical energy) in watts of any given circuit. Electromagnetic wattmeters are used for measurement of utility frequency and audio frequency power

Questions: Theodolite measures _____.
solution: :Theodolite is a surveying instrument with a rotating telescope for measuring horizontal and vertical angles

Questions: Which is used to receive and transmit a reply immediately ?
solution: :Transponder is a device for receiving a radio signal and automatically transmitting a different signal.

Questions: Flux meter is used to measures _____
solution: :A Fluxmeter is an electronic integrating, digital display instrument. The Fluxmeter can be used not only for the measurement of the magnetic flux of permanent magnets, but also for quality control and sorting of magnetic products.

Questions: Which of the following is used to records physiological movements graphically ?
solution: :A kymograph (which means Ĺwave writerĺ) is a device that gives a graphical representation of spatial position over time in which a spatial axis represents time.

Questions: Wave meter _____.. of a radiowave
solution: :A wavemeter (or wavelength meter) is a kind of interferometer which is used for precise wavelength measurements on laser beams.

Questions: _____.. is used to measure inner and outer diameter of solids
solution: :A caliper  is a device used to measure the distance between two opposite sides of an object and also used to measure inner and outer diameter of solids

Questions: Anemometer measures _____.. of wind
solution: :An anemometer is a device used for measuring Force and direction of wind. The term is derived from the Greek word anemos, which means wind, and is used to describe any wind speed measurement instrument used in meteorology .

Questions: Which is used to find the latitude of a place by navigators ?
solution: :A sextant is a doubly reflecting navigation instrument used to measure the latitude between any two visible objects. The principle of the instrument was first implemented around 1730 by John Hadley and Thomas Godfrey but it was also found later in the unpublished writings of Isaac Newton.

Questions: _____. of a vessel at sea is measured by Chronometer
solution: :Longitude by chronometer is a method, in navigation, of determining longitude using a marine chronometer, which was developed by John Harrison during the first half of the eighteenth century

Questions: Electrometer measures _____
solution: :An electrometer is an electrical instrument for measuring electric charge or electrical potential difference.

Questions: Which of the following is used to view the objects above the sea level ?
solution: :Periscope is used to view the objects above the sea level

Questions: Stereoscope used to view the _____ pictures
solution: :Stereoscope is a device by which two photographs of the same object taken at slightly different angles are viewed together, creating an impression of depth and solidity.

Questions: _____.. is an instrument for measuring the energy distribution of particular type of radiation
solution: :Spectrometer is an instrument for measuring the energy distribution of particular type of radiation.An apparatus used for recording and measuring spectra, especially as a method of analysis.

Questions: Udometer is also known as _____.
solution: :A rain gauge (also known as an udometer, pluviometer, or an ombrometer) is a type of instrument used by meteorologists and hydrologists to gather and measure the amount of liquid precipitation over a set period of time.

Questions: Which of the following is used to view rapidly moving objects ?
solution: :A stroboscope also known as a strobe, is an instrument used to make a cyclically moving object appear to be slow-moving, or stationary. It consists of either a rotating disk with slots or holes or a lamp such as a flashtube which produces brief repetitive flashes of light.

Questions: Which of the following has the highest specific heat Capacity ?
solution: :Specific heat Capacity of Water is  2200 J/KgoC, Paraffin ľ 2200 J/KgoC, Ice ľ 2108 J/KgoC, Glycerine ľ 2436 J/KgoC

Questions: _____ is the boiling point of Water in Rankine Scale ?
solution: :The boiling point of Water in Ranking Scale is 6720 Rankine temperature scale, temperature scale having an absolute zero, below which temperatures do not exist, and using a degree of the same size as that used by the Fahrenheit temperature scale.

solution: :The energy necessary to remove the electron from n = 10 the state in hydrogen atom will be 0.136eV

Questions: One nanometer is equal to _____
solution: :The nanometre or nanometer is a unit of length in the metric system, equal to one billionth of a metre ( 0.000000001 m or 10-9m)

Questions: The fourth state of matter is known as
solution: :Plasma is one of the four fundamental states of matter, the others being solid, liquid, and gas. A plasma has properties unlike those of the other states.

Questions: Which type of energy is oldest energy to man ?
solution: :Geothermal energy is thermal energy generated and stored in the Earth. Thermal energy is the energy that determines the temperature of matter.

Questions: In a photocell light energy is converted into _____.
solution: :Photocell is a solid-state electronic device that converts light into electrical energy by producing a voltage or that uses light to regulate the flow of current

solution: :The slope of Velocity ľ time graph represents Acceleration. The velocity vs. time graphs for the two types of motion ľ constant velocity and changing velocity Acceleration  is the rate of change of velocity of an object

Questions: Which is used to change the speed of the fan ?
solution: :Regulator is used  to regulate/control the speed of the fan and provide a convenient environment for the residents.

solution: :The temperature of metal wire increases when the current is passes through it

Questions: When a light wave is reflected from a mirror, there is a change in its _____.
solution: :When a light wave is reflected from a mirror, there is a change in its amplitude because reflected wave is reflected in phase with the incoming wave

Questions: What is the maximum escape velocity of rocket to be launched into Space ?
solution: :escape velocity is the minimum speed needed for an object to ôbreak freeö from the gravitational attraction of a massive body. The escape velocity from Earth is about 40,270 km/h (25,020 mph). The maximum escape velocity of rocket to be launched into Space is 11km/sec

Questions: Sound canĺt pass through _____..
solution: :Sound cannot travel through vaccum because there is no air molecules to vibrate sound

Questions: The dimension of which of the following is same as that of Impulse ?
solution: :Impulse has the same units and dimensions (M L T-1) as momentum. In the International System of Units, these are kgĚm/s = NĚs.

Questions: The strongest Force in nature is _____.
solution: :Strongest Force ľ Nuclear Force Weakest Force ľ Gravitational Force

Questions: An image formed on the Retina of an eye persists for about _____. after the removal of stimulus
solution: :An image formed on the Retina of an eye persists for about 0.1s after the removal of stimulus

Questions: Lens is made up of which type of glass ?
solution: :The currently known flint glasses have refractive indices ranging between 1 .45 and B)00. A concave lens of flint glass is commonly combined with a convex lens

Questions: Magnetism at the centre of the bar magnet is _____..
solution: :The density of the field lines on the picture is maximized at the ôpolesö of the bar magnet and minimized at the center

Questions: 1 kcal = ?
solution: :1 kcal = 1000 cal

Questions: A sunset and sunrises arises due to _____
solution: :The sunlight takes on an orange or red cast, which we can see reflected from clouds or other objects as a colorful sunset (or sunrisE).

Questions: The Voltage in a motor car battery is
solution: :Most lead acid batteries that cars use is of 12V(12 .6V to be precise, 2 .1V per cell

Questions: The sound produced by the bat is
solution: :Humans can only hear sound up to about 16KHz (thatĺs 16,000 cycles per seconD). Bats emit sounds at typically 2 or 3 times higher pitch than we can hear.

Questions: The minimum number of geostationary satellite needed for uninterrupted global coverages is _____.
solution: :2 is the absolute minimum to cover the earth but the satellites will not be able to contact one another.

Questions: The cooling system of a refrigerator always should be at the _____.
solution: :The Cooling system condenser coils, located at the bottom of the refrigerator (behind the kick platE)

Questions: A Black body can absorb radiations of _____
solution: :A black body is an idealized physical body that absorbs all incident electromagnetic radiation, regardless of frequency or angle of incidence.

Questions: The speed of light is _____ while passing through glass
solution: :The speed of light will be minimum while passing through glass because the optical density of glass is very high

solution: :If input frequency of a full wave rectifier be n, then output frequency would be 2n
