solution: :Vostok 1 was the first spaceflight of the Vostok programme and the first human spaceflight in history. The Vostok 3KA space capsule was launched on April 12, 1961 from Baikonur Cosmodrome with  Yuri Gagarin, making him the first human to cross into outer space.

Questions: _____.. was the first artificial satellite launched in space
solution: :Sputnik 1 was the first artificial Earth satellite. The Soviet Union launched it into an elliptical low Earth orbit on 4 October 1957.

Questions: Which of the living being was sent first into space ?
solution: :On November 3, 1957, Laika the dog rode Sputnik 2 into outer space, the first living creature to reach Earth orbit.

Questions: Which was the first spacecraft without man sent to space ?
solution: :The first unmanned flight of the spacecraft was launched on November 19, 1999, after which Project 921/1 was renamed Shenzhou, A series of three additional unmanned flights ensued.

Questions: Which of the following lab is the first space lab in orbit ?
solution: :Skylab was a space station launched and operated by NASA and was the United Statesí first space station. Skylab orbited Earth from 1973 to 1979, and included a workshop, a solar observatory, and other systems. It was launched unmanned by a modified Saturn V rocket.

Questions: Who was the first Indian to travel in space ?
solution: :Rakesh Sharma, AC, Hero of the Soviet Union, is a former Indian Air Force pilot who flew aboard Soyuz T-11, launched April 3, 1984, as part of the Intercosmos programme. Sharma was the first Indian to travel in space

Questions: Which of the following was the first space shuttle ?
solution: :Space Shuttle Columbia was the first space-rated Space Shuttle in NASAís orbiter fleet. It launched for the first time on mission STS-1 on 12 April 1981, the first flight of the Space Shuttle program

Questions: Who was an American astronaut and the first person to walk on the Moon ?
solution: :Neil Alden Armstrong was an American astronaut and the first person to walk on the Moon. He was an astronaut. He flew on two space missions.

Questions: Father of Indian space programme is _____..
solution: :Vikram Ambalal Sarabhai was an Indian scientist and innovator widely regarded as the father of Indiaís space programme.Sarabhai received the Shanti Swarup Bhatnagar Medal in 1962 . The nation honoured him awarding Padma Bhushan in 1966 and Padma Vibhushan (posthumously) in 1972 .

Questions: Indiaís first successful nuclear bomb test on 18 May 1974 in _____..
solution: :Smiling Buddha (Pokhran-I) was the assigned code name of Indiaís first successful nuclear bomb test on 18 May 1974 The bomb was detonated on the army base, Pokhran Test Range (PTR), in Rajasthan by the Indian Army

Questions: Who is known as ìfather of the Indian nuclear programmeî ?
solution: :Homi Jehangir Bhabha is mostly known as the chief architect of Indiaís nuclear programme. However, his contribution to Indiaís development goes far beyond the sphere of atomic energy. He also known as ìfather of the Indian nuclear programmeî

Questions: _____.is the first operational remote sensing satellite of India
solution: :India began to develop the indigenous Indian Remote Sensing (IRS) satellite program to support the national economy in the areas of agriculture, water resources, forestry and ecology, geology, water sheds, marine fisheries and coastal management.IRS 1A is the first operational remote sensing satellite

Questions: Which is the worldís first dedicated educational satellite ?
solution: :EDUSAT is the worldís first dedicated educational satellite, according to the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO). India launched the $20 million, 2-tonne EDUSAT from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre at Sriharikota, a tiny island in the Bay of Bengal on Sep 20, 2004

Questions: The Green house gases Observing Satellite ìIBUKIî (GOSAT) launched by _____..
solution: :The Greenhouse gases Observing Satellite ìIBUKIî (GOSAT), developed jointly by the Ministry of the Environment Japan, the National Institute for Environmental Studies, and the Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (hereinafter the Three Parties), is the worldís first satellite designed specifically for monitoring

Questions: Indiaís first microwave remote sensing satellite _____.was injected into orbit by the Polar Satellite Launch Vehicle
solution: :Indiaís first indigenous all-weather Radar Imaging Satellite (RISAT-1), whose images will facilitate agriculture and disaster management, was launched successfully on board the PSLV-C19The RISAT series are the first all-weather earth observation satellites from ISRO.

Questions: Sputnik 1 was the first artificial Earth satellite launched in _____.
solution: :Sputnik 1 was the first artificial Earth satellite. The Soviet Union launched it into an elliptical low Earth orbit on 4 October 1957

Correct: ñ A)Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System
Questions: IRNSS mean
solution: :The Indian Regional Navigation Satellite System or IRNSS is an indigenously developed Navigation Satellite System that is used to provide accurate real-time positioning and timing services over India and region extending to 1500 km around India.

Questions: INSAT-4E is also known _____..
solution: :INSAT-4E, also known as GSAT-6, is a member of the INSAT family and is a multimedia communication satellite that will offer a Satellite Digital Multimedia Broadcasting (S-DMB) service across several digital multimedia terminals or consoles which can be used to provide information services to vehicles on the fly and to the mobile phones.

Questions: AGILE is an X-ray and Gamma ray astronomical satellite of the _____.Space Agency
solution: :AGILE is an X-ray and Gamma ray astronomical satellite of the Italian Space Agency. AGILE was successfully launched on 23 April 2007, from the Indian base of Sriharikota and was inserted in an equatorial orbit

Questions: Indiaís Integrated Guided Missile Development Programme was started in _____.
solution: :Integrated Guided Missile Development Programme started in 1982ñ83 under the leadership of A. P. J. Abdul Kalam and ended in 2008 after these strategic missiles were successfully developed. The last major missile developed under the programme was the Agni 3 intermediate-range ballistic missile

Questions: The Akashís first flight occurred in _____
solution: :Akash is a medium-range mobile surface-to-air missile defense system developed by the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), Bharat Dynamics Limited (BDL) for Missile Systems, Ordnance Factories Board and Bharat Electronics (BEL) for other Systems in India.

Questions: Trishul is a which type of missile ?
solution: :Trishul is a short range surface-to-air missile developed by India. It was developed by Defence Research and Development Organisation as a part of the Integrated Guided Missile Development Program.

Questions: Astra is a state of the art beyond visual range air to air missile designed for a range of
solution: :Astra is an active radar homing beyond-visual-range air-to-air missile (BVRAAM)developed by the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO), India. Astra is designed to be capable of engaging targets at varying range and altitudes allowing for engagement of both short-range targets (up to 20 km) and long-range targets (up to 80 km) using alternative propulsion modes

Questions: Messenger is a spacecraft of which Planet ?
solution: :MESSENGER (MErcury Surface, Space ENvironment, GEochemistry, and Ranging, and a reference to the Roman mythological messenger, Mercury) was a NASA robotic spacecraft that orbited the planet Mercury between 2011 and 2015 . The spacecraft was launched aboard a Delta II rocket in August 2004 to study Mercuryís chemical composition,geology, and magnetic field.

Questions: Venus Express is a spacecraft for Venus. It was launched by _____..
solution: :Venus Express (VEX) was the first Venus exploration mission of the European Space Agency (ESA). Launched in November 2005, it arrived at Venus in April 2006 and began continuously sending back science data from its polar orbit around Venus.

Questions: _____. is a spacecraft for SATURN planet
solution: :CassiniñHuygens is an unmanned spacecraft sent to the planet Saturn. It is a flagship-class NASAñESAñASI robotic spacecraft.Cassini is the fourth space probe to visit Saturn and the first to enter orbit, and its mission is ongoing as of 2016. It has studied the planet and its many natural satellites since arriving there in 2004 .

Questions: GSAT -2 was launched in _____.
solution: :GSAT-2 was an experimental communication satellite built by the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) and launched on one of the first GSLVs. The satellite was positioned at 48 deg east longitude in the geo-stationary orbit.It was launched on 8th May, 2003

Questions: Voyager-2 is a spacecraft for which planet ?
solution: :The exploration of Uranus has, to date, been solely through telescopes and NASAís Voyager 2 spacecraft, which made its closest approach to Uranus on January 24, 1986. Voyager 2 discovered 10 moons, studied the planetís cold atmosphere, and examined its ring system, discovering two new rings.

Questions: India announced that it had destroyed all of its chemical weapons stocks in _____
solution: :India informed the United Nations in May 2009 that it had destroyed its stockpile of chemical weapons in compliance with the international Chemical Weapons Convention. With this India has become third country after South Korea and Albania to do so

Questions: SHAR centre is located in _____..
solution: :Satish Dhawan Space Centre or Sriharikota High Altitude Range is a rocket launch center operated by Indian Space Research Organisation. It is located in Sriharikota in Andhra Pradesh.

Questions: In _____ the Sriharikota Space Centre was renamed as Prof. Satish Dhawan Space Centre.
solution: :In 2002 the Sriharikota Space Centre was renamed as Prof. Satish Dhawan Space Centre.

Questions: Space Application Centre(SAC) is ISROís research and development centre for conceiving, organising and building systems for practical applications of space technology located in _____..
solution: :Space Application Centre(SAC) is ISROís research and development centre for conceiving, organising and building systems for practical applications of space technology located in Ahmedabad

Questions: Master Control Facility is located in _____..
NRSA is _____
solution: :National Remote Sensing Centre or NRSC, located at Hyderabad is one of the centres of the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO), striving to realise the Indian Space Vision, as a key player in Earth Observation Programme and Disaster Management Support programme

Questions: CNSA is the national space Agency of _____
solution: :The China National Space Administration (CNSA) is the national space agency of the Peopleís Republic of China. It is responsible for the national space program and for planning and development of space activities.

Questions: _____. is the national space agency of Japan
solution: :The Japan Aerospace eXploration Agency ) is the National Research and Development Agency on Aerospace Research and Developmentî), or JAXA, is Japanís national aero-space agency. Through the merger of three previously independent organizations, JAXA was formed on 1 October 2003 .

Questions: Which of the following centre is located at Dehradun ?
solution: :The Indian Institute of Remote Sensing is a premier institute for research, higher education and training in the field of Remote Sensing, Geoinformatics and GPS Technology for Natural Resources, Environmental and Disaster Management under the Indian Department of Space, which was established in the year 1966. It is located at Dehradun, Uttarakhand.

Questions: Regional Remote Sensing Service Centre(RRSSCs) is not located at _____..
solution: :Five Regional Remote Sensing Service Centres (RRSSCs) established under National Natural Resources Management System (NNRMS) by DOS at Bangalore, Jodhpur, Kharagpur (recently relocated to KolkatA), Dehradun and Nagpur have been integrated with NRSC and renamed as Regional Remote Sensing Centres (RRSCs) South, West, East, North and Central respectively on December 2, 2009.

Questions: National Atmospheric Research Laboratory(NARL) is located at _____..
solution: :NARL at Gadanki near Tirupati is an autonomous society supported by Department of Space.

Questions: The brightest planet is _____..
solution: :Venus is so bright because its thick clouds reflect most of the sunlight that reaches it (about 70%) back into space, and because it is the closest planet to Earth.

Questions: _____.. planet has rings on four sides
solution: :Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and the second-largest in the Solar System, after Jupiter. It is a gas giant with an average radius about nine times that of Earth.It has rings on four sides

Questions: Which is the nearest planet from the earth ?
solution: :Venus would be the closest planet to Earth. On rare occasions, Mercury can be the closest planet.

Questions: _____ is the  coldest body of our Solar system
solution: :Pluto is one of the coldest large bodies in the solar system. But despite the fact that it lies so far away.Pluto can reach temperatures of minus 369 degrees Fahrenheit (minus 223 degrees Celsius).

Questions: Which planet take maximum time to revolve around the Sun ?
solution: :Jupiter, the solar systemís largest planet, takes 4,331 .572 days to orbit around the sun, but the fast turning planet only takes 9.8 hours to completely rotate on its axis

Questions: _____ planet moves from east to west
solution: :All the Planets Spin West To East, Except Venus

Questions: Which of the following emits green light ?
solution: :Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and is the third largest in the Solar Sysytem. Methane in the upper atmosphere absorbs red light, giving Uranus its blue-green color.

Questions: _____.. spins on its axis at the fastest rate
solution: :Jupiter spins faster than any other planet, taking a little under 10 hours to complete a turn on its axis, compared with 24 hours for Earth

Questions: The fastest planet in the Solar system is _____..
solution: :Mercury is the closest planet to the sun. The surface of Mercury can reach temperatures of 460 degrees Celsius. Mercury is the fastest-moving planet in the solar system

Questions: _____.. is also known as red planet
solution: :Mars is often called the ëRed Planetí because it appears in the sky as an orange-red colour

Questions: _____. is the largest natural satellite in the solar system
solution: :Ganymede is the largest moon of Jupiter and in the Solar System, and the only moon known to have a magnetosphere. It is the seventh satellite outward from Jupiter

Questions: The family of stars with which the Sun is related is _____
solution: :A supernova is an explosion of a massive supergiant star. It may shine with the brightness of 10 billion suns. The total energy output may be 1044 joules.

Questions: Who was the first to view the Milky Way galaxy ?
solution: :Galileo first studied the Milky Way through his telescope in January, 1610

Questions: _____. is credited with the expounding of the theory of black holes
solution: :The theory of general relativity predicts that a sufficiently compact mass can deform spacetime to form a black hole.In 1931, Subrahmanyan Chandrasekhar calculated, using special relativity, that a non-rotating body of electron-degenerate matter above a certain limiting mass has no stable solutions

Questions: Cassini Spacecraft related to _____..
solution: :CassiniñHuygens is an unmanned spacecraft sent to the planet Saturn. It is a flagship-class NASAñESAñASI robotic spacecraft.Cassini is the fourth space probe to visit Saturn and the first to enter orbit, and its mission is ongoing as of 2016.

Questions: The transit of Venus was seen on 8th June, 2004 . This Celestial event took place after a gap of _____..
solution: :The Transit of Venus took place on 8th June 2004 after a gap of 122 years. The rarecelestial event was utilized by Vigyan Prasar as an opportunity to undertake large-scale science communication.

Questions: The brightness of star indicates its _____
solution: :The brightness of the star dependent upon the temperature of the star and the surface area of the star

Questions: Astronomer have determined the approximate age of Sun to be
solution: :The Sun formed about 4 .6 billion years(aaprox 1010 years) ago from the collapse of part of a giant molecular cloud that consisted mostly of hydrogen and helium and that probably gave birth to many other stars.

Questions: Asteroids move around the Sun in between _____..
solution: :Most asteroids orbit between Mars and Jupiter in the Main Asteriod Belt

Questions: Which planet of the solar system is as big as the Earth ?
solution: :Venus is the second planet from the Sun and the sixth largest. Venus is as big as earth Venus probably once had large amounts of water like Earth but it all boiled away.

Questions: The Sea of Tranquility situated on the _____
solution: :The Sea of Tranquility is a dark spot located in the northern hemisphere of the Moon. The sea is not a body of water but a lower-altitude plain

Questions: Cosmos 2406 is a Russian expedition to _____.
solution: :Cosmos 2406 is a Russian military satellite to Mars that was launched from Baikonur by a Zenit 2 rocket at 01:28 UT on 10 June 2004 . The satellite was reported to be a new Tselina-2 electronic intelligence satellite.

Questions: Which planets do not have their own satellite ?
solution: :Only Mercury and Venus do not have any moons

Questions: _____ is also known as evening star
solution: :One of the nicknames of Venus is ìthe Morning Starî. Itís also known as the Evening Star.

Questions: The Altitude of geostationary satellite is _____.
solution: :Geosynchronous orbits have altitudes up to 3600 km.

Questions: The distance of separation between two points in the space is known as _____..
solution: :The distance of separation between two points in the space is known as Orion.It is a prominent constellation located on the celestial equator and visible throughout the world.

Questions: Pulsar is a _____
solution: :A pulsar (short for pulsating radio star) is a highly magnetized, rotating neutron star that emits a beam of electromagnetic radiation.

Questions: _____. is also known as shooting star
solution: :Meteors, or shooting stars as they are more commonly known, are the streaks of light produced when a meteoroid burns up in the Earthís atmosphere.

Questions: The closest planet to the sun is _____.
solution: :Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the one closest to the Sun, with an orbital period of about 88 Earth days, which is much faster than any other planet in the Solar System.

Questions: _____. is the hottest planet in the solar system
solution: :The hottest planet in our solar system is Venus.It is the second closest planet to the Sun

Questions: The Study of Universe is known as _____
solution: :Cosmology is the study of the origin, evolution, and eventual fate of the universe.

Questions: _____ is the latest known galaxy
solution: :A dwarf galaxy is a small galaxy composed of up to several billion stars

Questions: Which of the following is the terrestrial planet ?
A ninth planet has been recently discovered by NASA named as _____
solution: :A ninth planet has been recently discovered by NASA named as Carla

Questions: _____. is also known as the Blue planet
solution: :Planet Earth has been called the ìBlue Planetî due to the abundant water on its surface

Questions: Selenology is the study of _____
solution: :Selenography is the study of the surface and physical features of the Moon.

Questions: Titan is the largest satellite of _____.
solution: :Titan (or Saturn VI) is the largest moon of Saturn. It is the only natural satellite known to have a dense atmosphere, and the only object other than Earth

Questions: Neptune is surrounded by _____.. rings of sub zero temperature
solution: :The clouds farthest from Neptuneís surface consist mainly of frozen methane

Questions: Which Planet is also known as Winter planet ?
solution: :Jupiter is called winter planet because Jupiter is visible all night long in our winterskies

Questions: _____. is the first planet to have been discovered by the use of a telescope
solution: :Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun. Itís not visible to the naked eye, and became the first planet discovered with the use of a telescope.

Questions: Prithvi-II for the _____.
solution: :Prithvi-II(Sanskrit: p?thvi ìEarthî) is a tactical surface-to-surface short-range ballistic missile (SRBM) developed by DRDO of India under the Integrated Guided Missile Development Program (IGMDP). It is deployed by Indiaís Strategic Forces Command. It was developed with the Indian Air Force being the primary user.

Questions: Dhanush developed for the which of the following ?
solution: :Dhanush (Sanskrit: ìBowî) is a variant of the surface-to-surface/ship-to-ship Prithvi III missile, which has been developed for the Indian Navy.

Questions: Barak-8 is a long-range anti-air and anti-missile naval defence system being developed jointly by _____ and DRDO
solution: :Barak-8 is a long-range anti-air and anti-missile naval defence system being developed jointly by Israel Aerospace Industries (IAI) and the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) of India

Questions: Akash is a mid-range _____.. missile
solution: :Akash (sky) is a mid-range surface-to-air missile (SAM). It is medium range nuclear capable supersonic missile. Indigenously developed by Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) under the Integrated Guided-Missile Development Programme (IGMDP).

Questions: The worldís first robot lawyer _____ has been employed by a US law firm BakerHostetler.
solution: :The worldís first robot lawyer named ëROSSí has been employed by a US law firm Baker Hostetler.  The ëROSSí robot is built upon IBMís cognitive computer Watson. It will function using Watsonís cognitive computing and natural language processing capabilities.

Questions: Who developed the Worldís first water-based computer along with his team ?
solution: :Manu Prakash, an Indian-origin scientist, who is also credited with the discovery of the paper microscope, only last year, has once again stunned the world by developing the Worldís first water-based computer along with his team, as published in the journal Nature Physics.

Questions: Which is is a large telescope in space ?
solution: :The Hubble Space Telescope is a large telescope in space. NASA launched Hubble in 1990. Hubble is as long as a large school bus.

Questions: Olympus Mons is a very large shield volcano on which Planet ?
solution: :Olympus Mons is a very large shield volcano on the planet Mars. By one measure, it has a height of nearly 25 km (16 mi). Olympus Mons stands almost three times as tall as Mount Everestís height above sea

Questions: The first digital and programmable robot was invented by
solution: :The first digital and programmable robot was invented by George Devol in 1954 and was named the Unimate. It was sold to General Motors in 1961 where it was used to lift pieces of hot metal from die casting machines at the Inland Fisher Guide Plant in the West Trenton section of Ewing Township, New Jersey

Questions: Prithvi-I missile was inducted into the _____ in 1994
solution: :Prithvi (Sanskrit: p?thvi ìEarthî) is a tactical surface-to-surface short-range ballistic missile .This class of Prithvi missile was inducted into the Indian Army in 1994

Questions: Which planet has highest number of moons ?
solution: :Jupiter has 67 moons or satellites. Jupiter is the fifth planet from the Sun and the largest in the Solar System.

Questions: Phobos is related to _____..
solution: :Mars has two known satellites, Phobos and Deimos

Questions: Which of the following is the second largest moon in the solar family ?
solution: :Titan (or Saturn VI) is the largest moon of Saturn. It is the second-largest moon in the Solar System, after Jupiterís moon Ganymede

Questions: _____.. was the first Kuiper belt object to be discovered
solution: :Pluto is a dwarf planet in the Kuiper belt, a ring of bodies beyond Neptune. It was the first Kuiper belt object to be discovered.

Questions: Miranda is the moon of which planet ?
solution: :Miranda or Uranus V is the smallest and innermost of Uranusís five round satellites. Like the other large moons of Uranus, Miranda orbits close to its planetís equatorial plane

Questions: Which of the following has no moons ?
solution: :Among the other dwarf planets, Ceres has no known moons. It is 90 percent certain that Ceres has no moons larger than 1 km in size, assuming that they would have the same albedo as Ceres itself.

Questions: _____.is a photograph of the Earth
solution: :The Blue Marble is a photograph of the Earth, taken on December 7, 1972, by the crew of the Apollo 17 spacecraft, at a distance of about 45,000 kilometers (28,000 miles).

Questions: NASA Satellite Camera Provides ìEPICî View of Earth. What is EPIC ?
solution: :The color image of Earth was taken by NASAís Earth Polychromatic Imaging Camera (EPIC), a four megapixel CCD camera and telescope. The image was generated by combining three separate images to create a photographic-quality image.The image was taken on July 6, 2015, showing North and Central America

Questions: Which planet is also called as ë Lord of Heavensí ?
solution: :Jupiter, because it is named after the Roman God Jupiter, who was ìLord of the Heavens.î

Questions: _____. is also called as Green Planet
solution: :Neptune is called as green planet because of the colours of the planets the greeny gass in the atmosphere of the frozen planet uranus and the pure iceball that is neptune.

Questions: The communication satellite GSAT -18 was launched in
solution: :Indiaís Communication satellite GSAT-18 was successfully launched from the European spacepad of Kourou in French Guiana on October 6 2016

Questions: Space lab Tiangong-2 is related to which country ?
solution: :Chinaís experimental space lab Tiangong-2 orbiting the Earth with two astronauts on board has successfully launched a micro-satellite, roughly the size of a desktop printer on October 26, 2016.

Questions: Which of the following is the Indiaís weather satellite ?
solution: :The Indian Space Research Organisationís (Isro) Geosynchronous Satellite Launch Vehicle-F05(GSLV-F05) lifted off from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre at Sriharikota in Andhra Pradesh, carrying with it the INSAT-3DR weather satellite on September 8, 2016

Questions: Worldís 1st Hack-Proof Communications Satellite launched by
solution: :China on August 16, 2016 successfully launched the worldís first quantum satellite which boasts of establishing ìhack-proofî communications between space and the ground as it is equipped with security features to prevent wiretapping and intercepts.The satellite was launched from the Jiuquan Satellite Launch Centre in northwestern Gobi Desert

Questions: Falcon 9 rocket was launched by
solution: :SpaceX successfully landed the first stage of its unmanned Falcon 9 rocket on a floating platform in the Atlantic Ocean early on Friday after launching a Japanese communications satellite into orbit.

Questions: The first manned AVATAR flight is proposed for
solution: :AVATAR from ìAerobic Vehicle for Transatmospheric Hypersonic Aerospace TrAnspoRtationî is a concept for a manned single-stage reusable spaceplane capable of horizontal takeoff and landing.The first scaled-down tests are planned for 2016, and the first manned AVATAR flight is proposed for 2025 .

Questions: _____. is a joint project of NASA and ISRO
solution: :Nasa-Isro Synthetic Aperture Radar (Nisar) is a joint project between NASA and ISRO to co-develop and launch a dual frequency synthetic aperture radar satellite to be used for remote sensing.

Questions: Aditya-1 is a mission to the _____..
solution: :ISRO plans to carry out a mission to the Sun by the year 2019-20.The probe is named as Aditya-1 and will weigh about 400 kg. It is the First Indian based Solar Coronagraph to study solar Corona in visible and near IR bands.

Questions: ISRO starts landing tests for which mission ?
solution: :The Indian Space Research Organsiation started a series of ground and aerial tests linked to the critical Moon landing of Chandrayaan-2, at its new site at Challakere in Chitradurga district, 400 km from Bengaluru.

Questions: Which satellite is launched by China for mobile telecommunication ?
solution: :China has successfully launched the first satellite dubbed as The Tiantong-01 for mobile telecommunication. It was launched on-board of the Long March-3B carrier rocket from Xichang Satellite Launch Centre.

Questions: The advanced weather satellite Himawari-9 was launched by which country ?
solution: :The first one, Himawari-8, was launched in October 2014 . Himawari-9 is Japanís ninth geostationary weather observatory since the first satellite in the Himawari, or sunflower, series launched in 1977.

Questions: Tianlian I-04 is the satellite belongs to which country ?
solution: :The satellite, Tianlian I-04, was launched on a Long March-3C carrier rocket from the Xichang Satellite Launch Centre

Questions: An advanced weather satellites GOES-R was launched by which space agency ?
solution: :NASA has successfully launched the A ìnext generationî US advanced weather satellites GOES-R from Cape Canaveral Air Force Station in Florida, US on November 20, 2016.

Questions: Which mission holds the Guinness World Record for the highest altitude fix of a GPS signal ?
solution: :NASAís Magnetospheric Multiscale Mission (MMS) now holds the Guinness World Record for the highest altitude fix of a GPS signal. The MMS satellites, which are operating in a highly elliptical orbit around the Earth, have set the record at 43,500 miles above the surface.

Questions: China launched  global carbon dioxide monitoring satellite __________to understand climate change
solution: :China launched a global carbon dioxide monitoring satellite TanSat to understand climate change, hours after it lifted nearly a week-long red alert for the worst smog that engulfed about 40 cities in the country.

Questions: First fully-owned satellite ground station abroad opened in which country ?
solution: :China opens 1st fully-owned satellite ground station abroad. China has launched its first fully- owned overseas satellite ground station near the North Pole which could enable Beijing to collect satellite data anywhere on the Earth at a speed it said was the fastest in the world.

Questions: Indiaís first LNG fuelled bus is introduced in which part of India ?
solution: :For the 1st time in the Country, an LNG fuelled bus has been launched by the Minister of Petroleum & Natural Gas, Shri Dharmendra Pradhan in the presence of Chief Minister of Kerala, Shri Pinarayi Vijayan at Thiruvananthapuram.

Questions: Which space agency launches ëSpace Garbage Truckí Into Orbit to Clean Up Space Debris ?
solution: :Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) recently launched into orbit a space junk collector to clean up space debris. Kounotori, which means stork in Japanese, blasted off from the southern Japanese island of Tanegashima on Dec. 9

Questions: Which Supercluster was found by astronomers in December 2016 ?
solution: :Astronomers have found one of the Universeís biggest superclusters of galaxies near the Milky Way. The Vela supercluster, which had previously gone undetected as it was hidden by stars and dust in the Milky Way, is a huge mass that influenced the motion of our Galaxy.

Questions: Worldís largest amphibious aircraft AG600 by which country ?
solution: :The AVIC AG600, also known as TA-600, is a large amphibious flying boat that is being designed and built in China by the Aviation Industry Corporation of China

Questions: The rocket Kuaizhou-1A (KZ-1A) launched by which country ?
solution: :The rocket Kuaizhou-1A (KZ-1A) has sent three satellites into space in its first commercial mission .The rocket, carrying the satellite JL-1 and two CubeSats XY-S1 and Caton-1, blasted off from northwestern Chinaís Jiuquan Satellite Launch Center

Questions: Pinaka is a multiple rocket launcher inducted into ____________
solution: :Pinaka is a multiple rocket launcher produced in India and developed by the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) for the Indian Army. The system has a maximum range of 40 km for Mark-I and 65 km for Mark-II

Questions: Which become Indiaís first warship to have ATM onboard ?
solution: :Indiaís biggest aircraft carrier ship INS Vikramaditya is set to make history by the becoming the nationís first warship to have an ATM onboard the vessel via satellite.

Questions: Which country has launched its first military communications satellite Kirameki-2 ?
solution: :Japan launched Kirameki-2 communications satellite, which will enable it to quickly share information about ballistic missiles launched by North Korea or videos of Japanese troops deployed overseas.

Questions: Surface-to- surface ballistic missile (SSM) ëAbabeelí is related with which country ?
solution: :Pakistan successfully conducted the first test flight of the ëAbabeelí surface-to- surface ballistic missile (SSM) capable of carrying a nuclear warhead up to 2,200 kms.

Questions: ________________ was Indiaís  first dedicated multi-wavelength space observatory
solution: :Astrosat is Indiaís first dedicated multi-wavelength space observatory. It was launched on a PSLV-XL on 28 September 2015 .

Questions: INS____________ becomes Indiaís first ship to go green
solution: :Indian Navyís survey vessel INS Sarvekshak, based at the Southern Naval Command in Kochi became the first naval ship to go green by installing a solar power system on board

Questions: In February 2017, ISRO launched Cartosat-2 series satellite with how many satellites ?

Questions: Jnapith Award has been presented for works in how many languages ?

Questions: World Wetland Day is observed on _____
solution: :World Wetland Day marks the date of the signing of the Convention on Wetlands, called the Ramsar Convention, on 2 February 1971, in the Iranian city of Ramsar on the shores of the Caspian Sea.

Questions: When World Wildlife Day is celebrated ?
solution: :On 20 December 2013, at its 68th session, the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) decided to proclaim 3 March, the day of the adoption of the Convention on International Trade in Endangered Species of Wild Fauna and Flora (CITES), as World Wildlife Day, which proposed by Thailand to celebrate and raise awareness of the worldís wild fauna and flora.

Questions: International Day of Zero Tolerance to Female Genital Mutilation is observed on _____..
solution: :International Day of Zero Tolerance to Female Genital Mutilation is a UN-sponsored awareness day that takes place February 6 each year.It is an effort to make the world aware of female genital mutilation (also called FGM) and to promote its eradication.

Questions: On which date World Day of Fight Against Sexual Exploitation is celebrated ?
solution: :March 4 is observed as World Day of Fight Against Sexual Exploitation every year since 2009, to create awareness against sexual exploitation, which  overwhelmingly involves women and children.

Questions: March 8th  is observed as _____..
solution: :International Womenís Day (IWD), originally called International Working Womenís Day, is celebrated on March 8 every year.In different regions the focus of the celebrations ranges from general celebration of respect, appreciation, and love towards women to a celebration for womenís economic, political, and social achievements.

Questions: When World Sparrow Day is observed ?
solution: :World Sparrow Day is a day designated to raise awareness of the house sparrow and other common birds to urban environments, and of threats to their populations, observed on 20 March. It is an international initiative by the Nature Forever Society of India .

Questions: World Water Day is observed on _____..
solution: :World Water Day is an annual event celebrated on March 22 . The day focuses attention on the importance of freshwater and advocates for the sustainable management of freshwater resources. This day was first formally proposed in Agenda 21 of the 1992 United Nations Conference on Environment and Development in Rio de Janeiro.

Questions: When International Day of Remembrance of the Victims of Slavery and the Transatlantic Slave Trade is observed _____
solution: :International Day of Remembrance of the Victims of Slavery and the Transatlantic Slave Trade is a United Nations international observance designated in 2007 to be marked on 25 March every year. The day honours and remembers those who suffered and died as a consequence of the transatlantic slave trade.

Questions: March 24 is observed as _____..
solution: :World Tuberculosis Day, falling on March 24 each year, is designed to build public awareness about the global epidemic of tuberculosis (TB) and efforts to eliminate the disease. In 2012, 8.6 million people fell ill with TB, and 1 .3 million died from the disease, mostly in the Third World.

Questions: International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination is observed on _____.
solution: :The International Day for the Elimination of Racial Discrimination is observed annually on 21 March. On that day, in 1960, police opened fire and killed 69 people at a peaceful demonstration in Sharpeville, South Africa, against the apartheid pass laws.

Questions: World Autism Awareness Dayis a nationally observed day on _____ year
solution: :World Autism Awareness Day is a nationally observed day on the 2nd of April every year, encouraging Member States of the United Nations to take measures to raise awareness about children with autism throughout the world. It was designated by the United Nations General Assembly resolution ì62/139î

Questions: Second Thursday in March is observed as _____..
solution: :World Kidney Day (WKD) is a global health awareness campaign focusing on the importance of the kidneys and reducing the frequency and impact of kidney disease and its associated health problems worldwide.World Kidney Day is observed annually on the 2nd Thursday in March(March 10, 2016)

Questions: National Defence Day is celebrated on _____.every year
solution: :National Defence Day is observed on March 3 every year. To commemorate this day, worldís largest and tallest Indian tricolour was unfurled at Town Park in Faridabad.

Questions: World Malaria Day is is an international observance commemorated every year on _____..
solution: :World Malaria Day (WMD) is an international observance commemorated every year on 25 April and recognizes global efforts to control malaria. Globally, 3 .3 billion people in 106 countries are at risk of malaria

Questions: May 8 is celebrated as _____.
solution: :World Red Cross and Red Crescent Day is an annual celebration of the principles of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement. World Red Cross Red Crescent Day is celebrated on 8 May each year.This date is the anniversary of the birth of Henry Dunant (born 8 May 1828), the founder of International Committee of the Red Cross (ICRC) and the recipient of the first Nobel Peace Prize.

Questions: National Technology Day is celebrated on _____
solution: :May 11 is annually observed as National Technology Day all over India to commemorate technological breakthroughs like mastering of nuclear weapons technology (Pokharan II)

Questions: _____.. is celebrated annually on 27th March
solution: :World Theatre Day was initiated in 1961 by the International Theatre Institute (ITI). It is celebrated annually on the 27th March by ITI Centres and the international theatre community. Various national and international theatre events are organized to mark this occasion.

Questions: International Labour Day is observed on _____..
solution: :International Workersí Day, also known as Labour Day in some places, is a celebration of labourers and the working classes that is promoted by the international labour movement, anarchists, socialists.

Questions: UNESCO established 18 April as the _____.for Monuments and Sites
solution: :UNESCO established 18 April as the International Day for Monuments and Sites in 1983 . It aims to raise public awareness about the diversity and vulnerability of theworldís built monuments and heritage sites and the efforts required to protect and conserve them.

Questions: _____ the International Day of Families, proclaimed by theUN General Assembly in 1993
solution: :May 15 is the International Day of Families, proclaimed by the UN General Assembly in 1993 with resolution A/RES/47/237. The day reflects the importance the international community attaches to families. The first such day was observed on May 15, 1994 .

Questions: World Intellectual Property day is celebrated on _____..

Questions: _____ is observed around the world every year on May 31
solution: :World No Tobacco Day (WNTD) is observed around the world every year on May 31 . It is intended to encourage a 24-hour period of abstinence from all forms of  tobacco consumption around the globe.

Questions: Earth Day is an annual event, celebrated on _____.
solution: :Earth Day is an annual event, celebrated on April 22, on which day events worldwide are held to demonstrate support for environmental protection. It was first celebrated in 1970, and is now coordinated globally by the Earth Day Network

Questions: World Book Days is a yearly event on _____ by theUnited Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization(UNESCO).

solution: :World Asthma Day is an annual event organized by the Global Initiative for Asthma (GINA) to improve asthma awareness and care around the world. World Asthma Day takes place on the first Tuesday of May

Questions: International Day of UN Peacekeepers is observed on _____..
solution: :The ìInternational Day of United Nations Peacekeepersî, May 29, is ìa day to pay tribute to all the men and women who have served and continue to serve in United Nations peacekeeping operations for their high level of professionalism, dedication, and courage and to honor the memory of those who have lost their lives in the cause of peace.î

Questions: Motherís Day is observed on the _____..
solution: :Motherís Day is observed the second Sunday in May. It is a time to honor mothers, grandmothers, and great-grandmothers for their contribution to family and society.

Questions: _____.. is a day established by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) on June 1st each year since 2001
solution: :World Milk Day is a day established by the Food and Agriculture Organization (FAO) of the United Nations to recognise the importance of milk as a global food.It has been observed on June 1st each year since 2001 .

solution: :International Yoga Day  or simply Yoga Day, is celebrated annually on June 21 and was declared to be internationally recognized by the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) on December 11, 2014 .

Questions: Which day is observed on July 11 ?

Questions: _____. day is observed on September 8
solution: :September 8 was proclaimed International Literacy Day by UNESCO on November 17, 1965 . Its aim is to highlight the importance of literacy to individuals, communities and societies. Questions: International Nelson Mandela Day is celebrated on _____..

Questions: Which day is observed on August 6  ?

But on August 19, 1839, the French government announced the invention as the first practical gift to the world

solution: :An industry day is an event held by a military on August 30 to present requirements to industry representatives for weapons or vehicles. Common presentation methods include outlines by powerpoint

solution: :World Mental Health Day (10 October) is a day for global mental health  education,  awareness and advocacy.It was first celebrated in 1992 at the initiative of the World Federation for Mental Health, a global mental health organization with members and contacts in more than 150 countries.

Questions: January 25th is observed as _____..

Questions: International Day of Commemoration in Memory of the Victims of the Holocaust observed on
solution: :January 27th  ñ International Day of Commemoration in Memory of the Victims of the Holocaust International Holocaust Remembrance Day, is an international memorial day on 27 January commemorating the victims of the Holocaust. It commemorates the genocide that resulted in the death of an estimated 6 million Jews, 1 million Roma, 250,000 mentally and physically disabled people, and 9,000 homosexual men by the Nazi regime and its collaborators. It was designated by the United Nations General Assembly

Questions: January 26th is observed as _____
solution: :January 26th  ñ International Customs Day Annually held on January 26, International Customs Day (ICD) recognizes the role of custom officials and agencies in maintaining border security. It focuses on the working conditions and challenges that customs officers face in their jobs.

solution: :February 13th ñ World Radio Day World Radio Day is an observance day held annually on 13 February. World Radio Day is about celebrating radio, why we love it and why we need it today more than ever. A day to remember the unique power of radio to touch lives and bring people together across every corner of the globe. It was proclaimed on 3 November 2011 by UNESCO

Questions: World Cancer Day is observed on _____

Questions: February 28 is observed as _____

solution: :International Mother Language Day (IMLD) is a worldwide annual observance held on 21 February to promote awareness of linguistic and cultural diversity and multilingualism.

Questions: Which type of agriculture is also known as ‘Slash and burn farming’ ?
solution: :Slash and burn farming is a form of shifting agriculture where the natural vegetation is cut down and burned as a method of clearing the land for cultivation, and then, when the plot becomes infertile, the farmer moves to a new fresh plot and does the same again. This process is repeated over and over.

Questions: What is millet in agriculture ?
solution: :Millets are a group of highly variable small-seeded grasses, widely grown around the world as cereal crops or grains for fodder and human food.

Questions: The Rent theory of profit is given by whom ?
solution: :Prof F. A. Walker propounded the theory of profit, known as rent theory of profit. According to him “as rent is the difference between least and most fertile land similarly, profit is the difference between earnings of the least and most efficient entrepreneurs.

Questions: Crops are grown between the rows of trees or shrubs is a type of which cropping ?

Questions: Which of the following true with respect to Parallel cropping ?
solution: :When two crops are grown in a same time in a particular land as parallel to each other but those crops have different growth habits, no competition and they can express their full yield potential, then it is called parallel cropping.

Questions: Re-harvesting is also known as
solution: :Ratoon cropping is growing a fresh crop from the stubbles or suckers of the plant crop without replanting . It is also referred to as stubble cropping, re-harvesting.

solution: :In agriculture, multiple cropping is the practice of growing two or more crops in the same piece of land during a single growing season. It is a form of polyculture Ex: tomatoes + onions + marigold

Questions: A Food Security Mission was launched in 2007 for which of the following?
solution: :The National Development Council (NDC) in its 53rd meeting held on 29th May, 2007 adopted a resolution to launch a Food Security Mission comprising rice, wheat and pulses to increase the production of rice by 10 million tons, wheat by 8 million tons and pulses by 2 million tons by the end of the Eleventh Plan (2011-12).

Questions: The suitable climate for rice cultivation in India is
solution: :Rice is the staple crop of India. It is grown well in hot and moist climate. The geographical conditions for Rice Cultivation are : Temperature: 16°C – 27°C and rainfall 100 cm to 200 cm is ideal for rice growing

Questions: In which year Zamindari System was introduced in India by Cornwallis?

Questions: India’s first agricultural university is established in which state ?

Questions: An agricultural produce market committee (APMC) is established by which of the following ?
solution: :An agricultural produce market committee (APMC) is a marketing board established by a state government in India.

solution: :National Agricultural Cooperative Marketing Federation of India Ltd (NAFED) is an apex organization of marketing cooperatives for agricultural produce in India, under Ministry of Agriculture, Government of India.

Questions: Agriculture is in __________ list of the legislative section
solution: :Agriculture is in state list. Centre can make laws in state list based on international treaties.

solution: :The Agriculture Ministry has prepared a model APMC Act and circulated to various States and Union Territories in 2003 for implementation.

Questions: The headquarters of Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP) is in
solution: :Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP) formally known as Agricultural Prices Commission is a decentralized agency of the Government of India. Questions: A plantation of grape-bearing vines, grown mainly for winemaking is called as
solution: :A vineyard is a plantation of grape-bearing vines, grown mainly for winemaking, but also raisins, table grapes and non-alcoholic grape juice. The science, practice and study of vineyard production is known as viticulture

Questions: ______________ is known as Pseudocereal
solution: :Pseudocereals are non-grasses that are used in much the same way as cereals (true cereals are grasses).Examples of pseudocereals are amaranth (Love-lies-bleeding, red amaranth, Prince-of-Wales-feather), quinoa and buckwheat

Questions: The Slash-and-burn agriculture
solution: :Slash-and-burn agriculture, or fire–fallow cultivation, is a farming method that involves the cutting and burning of plants in a forest or woodland to create a field called a swidden

Questions: The Indira Gandhi Canal is related with which two states ?
solution: :The Indira Gandhi Canal is one of the largest canal projects in India. It starts from the Harike Barrage at Harike, a few kilometers below the confluence of the Satluj and Beas rivers in the Indian state of Punjab and terminates in irrigation facilities in the Thar Desert in the north west of Rajasthan state.

Questions: In India, Jute cultivation familiar with which Delta ?
solution: :Almost 85% of the world’s jute cultivation is concentrated in the Ganges Delta. This fertile geographic region is shared by both Bangladesh and India (mainly West Bengal).

Questions: _______________ is the science that deals with the utilization, reproduction and its vivid uses
solution: :The study of domestic and pet animals is called animal husbandry.The science that deals with the utilization, reproduction and its vivid uses is known as animal petting

Questions: The headquarters of World Agroforestry Centre is situated in which country ?
solution: :The World Agroforestry Centre, is an international institute headquartered in Nairobi, Kenya, and founded in 1978 as “International Council for Research in Agroforestry”

Questions: The cultivation of food, forage or specialty crops between rows of trees is known as _______
solution: :In alley cropping, an agricultural crop is grown simultaneously with a long-term tree crop to provide annual income while the tree crop matures.

Questions: The process of combines trees with forage and livestock production is also called as
solution: :Silvopasture combines trees with forage and livestock production. The trees are managed for high-value sawlogs and, at the same time, provide shade and shelter for livestock and forage, reducing stress and sometimes increasing forage production

Questions: The term represent the presence of trees widely scattered over a large agricultural plot or pasture ?
solution: :Parklands are visually defined by the presence of trees widely scattered over a large agricultural plot or pasture. The trees are usually of a single species with clear regional favorites.

Questions: In which cropping system, the trees or shrubs are planted in wide strip ?
solution: :Strip cropping is a method of farming which involves cultivating a field partitioned into long, narrow strips which are alternated in a crop rotation system

Questions: Taungya is a form of agroforestry system originated from which country ?
solution: :Taungya system is a form of agroforestry system in which short term crops are grown in the early years of the plantation of a woody perennials species in order to utilize the land, control weeds, reduce establishment costs, generate early income and stimulate the development of the woody perennials species.

Questions: A practice and ideology of limited participation in the conventional economy and minimal consumption of resources is known as _____________
solution: :Freeganism is a practice and ideology of limited participation in the conventional economy and minimal consumption of resources, particularly through recovering wasted goods like food.

Questions: The development of agricultural ecosystems intended to be sustainable and self-sufficient is called as
solution: :Permaculture is a system of agricultural and social design principles centered around simulating or directly utilizing the patterns and features observed in natural ecosystems.

Questions: ______________ is an area of land devoted to the cultivation of fruit or nut trees.
solution: :An orchard is an intentional planting of trees or shrubs that is maintained for food production. Orchards comprise fruit- or nut-producing trees which are generally grown for commercial production.

Questions: Who among the following led the Bhoodan and Gramdan movements ?
solution: :The Bhoodan and Gramdan movements led by Vinoba Bhave attempted to bring about a “non-violent revolution” in India’s land reforms programme.

Questions: The Bhoodan movement was started in the year __________
solution: :The Bhoodan was started in 1951 . The movement received widespread political patronage. Several state government passed laws by aimed at Gramdan and Bhoodan. The movement reached their peak around 1969. This is also known as the Blood-less Revolution.

Questions: The headquarters of National Biodiversity Board located in which city ?
solution: :National Biodiversity Board located in New Delhi

__________ is analogous to a relay race where crop hands over land to next crop in quick succession
solution: :Relay cropping is the growing of two or more crops on the same field with the planting of the second crop after the first one has completed its development

Questions: Which type of plants, bear their fruit in pods ?
solution: :Legumes are plants that bear their fruit in pods, which are casings with two halves, or hinges. Legumes are a very healthy food because it is low in fat and high in protein. Legumes are also very high in fiber and other nutrients

Questions: In agriculture, CWT mean
solution: :The hundredweight (CWT), formerly also known as the centum weight or quintal, , and US customary unit of weight or mass of various values. Its present value continues to differ between the American and imperial systems.

Questions: Which bacteria is legume root-nodule bacteria ?
solution: :Rhizobia are bacteria that fix nitrogen after becoming established inside root nodules of legumes

Questions: One animal unit is equal to_____________ lb
solution: :The animal unit (AU) is a standard unit used in calculating the relative grazing impact of different kinds and classes of livestock. One animal unit is defined as a 1000 lb (450 kg) beef cow with or without a nursing calf, with a daily dry matter forage requirement of 26 lb (11 .8 kg).

Questions: ______________is the plowing under or soil incorporation of any green manure crops
solution: :Green manuring is growing in the field plants usually belonging to leguminous family and incorporating into the soil after sufficient growth. The plants that are grown for green manure known as green manure crops.

Questions: To raising a crop with re growth coming out of roots or stalks after harvest of the crop is known as
solution: :Ratooning is a method of harvesting a crop which leaves the roots and the lower parts of the plant uncut to give the ratoon or the stubble crop. The main benefit of ratooning is that the crop matures earlier in the season.

Questions: The Cocoa plants were introduced from which country ?
solution: :In 1843 Cocoa plants introduced in India from West Indies

Questions: In 1820, Agricultural Society of India was opened in which state ?
solution: :Agricultural Society of India was established by Reverend William Carey on September 14, 1820 at Kolkata, West Bengal

Questions: Floriculture is related with _____________
solution: :Floriculture, or flower farming, is a discipline of horticulture concerned with the cultivation of flowering and ornamental plants for gardens and for floristry, comprising the floral industry.

Questions: Which of the following is the unit of Soil Erosion ?
solution: :Soil Erosion is measured as mass /unit area – tonne/ha or Kg/sq.m

Questions: Hjulström diagram used to determine ______________
solution: :Erodability (or erodibility) is the inherent yielding or nonresistance of soils and rocks to erosion. A high erodability implies that the same amount of work exerted by the erosion processes leads to a larger removal of material. The first studies on the erodibility of materials were done by Hjulström in canals

Questions: _______________is a piece of sloped plane that has been cut into a series of successively receding flat surfaces
solution: :In agriculture, a terrace is a piece of sloped plane that has been cut into a series of successively receding flat surfaces or platforms, which resemble steps, for the purposes of more effective farming . This type of landscaping, therefore, is called terracing.

Questions: The water that held tightly on the surface of soil colloidal particle is known as _________
solution: :Hygroscopic Water – Water absorbed from the atmosphere and held very tightly by the soil particles, so that it is unavailable to plants in amounts sufficient for them to survive.

Questions: Which of the following effect is used in agriculture to supply heat for evaporation ?
solution: :Oasis effect is the exchange of heat whereby air over crop is cooled to supply heat for evaporation.

Questions: ____________  is the slow flow of a liquid through something.
solution: :Seepage is the water escaped through the soil under gravitational forces.

OptionA: Ministry of Health and Family Welfare
Questions: Central Minikit Testing Programme on Fodder Crops administered by
solution: :The main objective of the scheme is to popularize the latest improved fodder varieties amongst the farmers for fodder/fodder seed production in order to bridge the gap between demand and supply of the fodder. Implementing Agency: Department of Animal Husbandry, Dairying & Fisheries, Ministry of Agriculture.

Questions: Small Farmers Development Agency (SFDA) was established by the recommendation of which committee ?
solution: :In 1969, All-India Rural Credit Review Committee headed by B. Venkatappiah. This committee recommended establishment of Small Farmers Development Agency (SFDA)

Questions: _____________ is the study of periodic plant and animal life cycle events
solution: :Phenology is the study of periodic plant and animal life cycle events and how these are influenced by seasonal and interannual variations in climate, as well as habitat factors (such as elevation).
:Permanent Wilting Point (PWP) or wilting point (WP) is defined as the minimal point of soil moisture the plant requires not to wilt.

Questions: Edaphic is a nature of which of the following ?
solution: :Edaphic is a nature related to soil. Edaphic qualities may characterize the soil itself, including drainage, texture, or chemical properties such as soil pH.

Questions: ‘Prabhat’-an extra early variety of which crop ?
solution: :‘Prabhat’-an extra early variety of Red Gram. . Prabhat, which arose as segregant from variety T-21, matures in 110 to 115 days. The plant type is determinate, bunchy, flat-topped.

Questions: In India, Watermelon crop grown in which season?
solution: :In the Indian sub-continent, the crops grown on irrigated lands which do not have to wait for monsoons, in the short duration between Rabi and Kharif crop season, mainly from March to June, are called Zaid crops. Ex:  Watermelon, Bitter gourd.

Questions: _________________  is a typical characteristics of Commercial grain farming
solution: :Monoculture is the agricultural practice of producing or growing a single crop, plant, or livestock species, variety, or breed in a field or farming system at a time. Monoculture is widely used in both industrial farming and organic farming and has allowed increased efficiency in planting and harvest.

Questions: Which micronutrient is essential for plant growth ?
solution: :Boron is an essential micronutrient which means it is essential for plant growth and development, but is required in very small quantities

Questions: Curing is the process of removing _____________ from tobacco
solution: :Removal of moisture from tobacco leaves without affecting its aroma, colour and texture is called curing in tobacco.

Questions: Potatoes will often go green color due to ___________________________
solution: :Potatoes will often go green when they’re not stored properly and they’re exposed to light. This is due to formation of chlorophyll (which is found in all green plants).

Questions: Minimum Support Price (MSP) is fixed by which of the following ?
solution: :Minimum Support Price (MSP) is a form of market intervention by the Government of India to insure agricultural producers against any sharp fall in farm prices. The minimum support prices are announced by the Government of India at the beginning of the sowing season for certain crops on the basis of the recommendations of the Commission for Agricultural Costs and Prices (CACP).

Questions: _______________formulations are applied as suspensions after dispersion in water
solution: :A wettable powder is an insecticide or other pesticide formulation consisting of the active ingredient in a finely ground state combined with wetting agents and sometimes bulking agents.

Questions: Which is an example of Sorosis ?
solution: :Sorosis, a botanical term for any plant that produces clusters of flowers out of which grows a single, compound fruit, like a pineapple.

Questions: Who is the father of Agricultural Engineering in India
solution: :Mason Vaugh is the father of Agricultural Engineering in India. He was an agricultural engineer at Allahabad Agricultural University. He is the first person to start research in the field of agricultural engineering and became the father of Agricultural Engineering in early forties.

Questions: Dr. Norman Borlaug is related with which revolution ?
solution: :Dr. Norman Borlaug is often called “the father of the Green Revolution” and is credited with saving over a billion people worldwide from starvation

Questions: Reserve Bank Of India College of Agricultural Banking located in which state ?
solution: :The Reserve Bank of India’s College of Agricultural Banking (CAB) is located in Pune, Maharashtra.

Questions: The study of agriculture is known as
solution: :The study of agriculture is known as agricultural science.

Questions: Which country play an important role in world’s food supply system ?
solution: :Australia’s agricultural industry is a key part of the world’s food supply system.

Questions: In India, agricultural census is conducted  every ……………
solution: :Every five years, an agricultural census is conducted in India. First such census was done in 1970s and the reference year for the first Agriculture Census was 1970-71 .

Questions: Maximum number of operational land holdings in India is which type of holding ?
solution: :Maximum number of operational land holdings in India is marginal holdings. According to Census 2011, 67 per cent of holdings were classified as marginal (less than one hectarE) and 18 per cent were classified as small (one-two hectarE). Large holdings were estimated to be only 0.7%.

Questions: The first Agriculture Census was  conducted in the year
solution: :Every five years, an agricultural census is conducted in India. First such census was done in 1970s and the reference year for the first Agriculture Census was 1970-71 .

Questions: The Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) is located in
solution: :The Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) is an autonomous body responsible for co-ordinating agricultural education and research in India.

Questions: Who is also  known as “Indian Father of Green Revolution” ?
solution: :Swaminathan is known as “Indian Father of Green Revolution” for his leadership and success in introducing and further developing high-yielding varieties of wheat in India.

Questions: GI tag is governed which international organization ?
solution: :At international level, GI is governed by World Trade Organisation’s (WTO’s) Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights (TRIPS )

Questions: The famous Chikan craft is belongs to which city of UP ?

Questions: Pattachitra is a form of art that originated in which state ?

Questions: The GI products comes from _____________
solution: :Product comes from a particular place/region while trade mark products comes from a particular enterprise/company.

Questions: The Geographical Indications of Goods (Registration & Protection)Act, 1999 has come into force from which year ?
solution: :India, as a member of the World Trade Organization (WTO), enacted the Geographical Indications of Goods (Registration & Protection)Act, 1999 has come into force with effect from 15th September 2003 .

Questions: ______________ is a first handmade tool from micro and small and medium enterprise registered for a geographical indicator (GI) tag

Questions: …………………….. was located in Bihar

Questions: Which one of the following located in Uttar Pradesh?

Questions: Which of the following lake is the largest freshwater lake in North -East India ?

Questions: The Wular lake is located in ……………….

Questions: …………………… is the longest lake in India and the largest lake in the state of Kerala

Questions: The Chilika Lake is situated in which state ?

Questions: Which of the following is related to J & K ?

Questions: ……………. is the India’s largest inland salt lake in Rajasthan

Questions: The Pangong lake is situated in ……………..

Questions: Begumpet Airport was located at ………………….

Questions: ………………… are the centres of low pressure surrounded by closed isobars having increasing pressure outwards
solution: :In meteorology, a cyclone is an area of closed, circular fluid motion rotating in the same direction as the Earth. This is usually characterized by inward spiraling winds that rotate counterclockwise in the Northern Hemisphere and clockwise in the Southern Hemisphere of the Earth

Questions: Cyclone distributed in china Sea is called as …………………
solution: :Cyclone distributed in china Sea is called as Typhoons. Typhoon Haiyan, known as Super Typhoon Yolanda in the Philippines, was one of five additional landfalls in the country before emerging over the South China Sea.

Questions: Tropical Cyclones travels from …………………….. to ……………… in the Easterly wind belt
solution: :Tropical Cyclones travels from East to West in the Easterly wind belt

Questions: Which type of cyclone is flow from West to East embedded in the Westerly wind belt ?
solution: :Temperature Cyclone is flow from West to East embedded in the Westerly wind belt .

Questions: Secondary winds reverse its direction completely in every……………………
solution: :Secondary winds reverse its direction completely in every 6 months.The best example is Monsoon Winds

Questions: When the relative humidity reaches ………………… the air is completely saturated
solution: :When the relative humidity reaches 100% the air is completely saturated

Questions: Which type of cyclone is distributed in Indian Ocean ?
solution: :A tropical cyclone is a rapidly rotating storm system characterized by a low-pressure center, strong winds, and a spiral arrangement of thunderstorms that produce heavy rain.It’s distribution region is Indian Ocean.

Questions: Haze is formed by water particles and its visibility lies between …………………………
solution: :Haze is traditionally an atmospheric phenomenon where dust, smoke and other dry particles obscure the clarity of the sky.Its visibility lies between 1km to 2km

Questions: Humidity of air refers to the contents of ………………….. in the air
solution: :Humidity is the amount of water vapor in the air. Water vapor is the gaseous state of water and is invisible.Humidity indicates the likelihood of precipitation, dew, or fog.It is measured by Hygometer

Questions: Cyclone distribution region Caribbean Sea is called as
solution: :A hurricane is a huge storm.It’s distributed region is Caribebean sea.It can be up to 600 miles across and have strong winds spiraling inward and upward at speeds of 75 to 200 mph

Questions: Fog is made from the droplets of water suspended in the ………………………. layer of atmosphere
solution: :Fog is made from the droplets of water suspended in the lower layer of atmosphere.Fog is a complex atmospheric phenomenon. It is a visible mass consisting of cloud water droplets or ice crystals suspended in the air at or near the Earth’s surface

Questions: …………………… is lying in level sheets and is used for layer type of clouds
solution: :Stratus” means “layer” and refers to the group of clouds that form in bigsheets covering the entire sky.It is lying in level sheets and is used for layer type of clouds

Questions: Clouds are the ………………………….. of small water droplets or tiny ice crystals
solution: :Clouds are the mass of small water droplets or tiny ice crystals

Questions: Clouds of great vertical extents ……………………….. to ………………………….

Questions: In atmosphere at every 165m there is a drop of ……………………..

:El Niño is a climate cycle in the Pacific Ocean with a global impact on weather patterns.
