solution: :In the period between the two World Wars, the city’s elegant architecture and the sophistication of its elite earned  Bucharest the nickname of “Little Paris”

Questions: Which city is known as ‘Garden provice of south Africa’ ?
solution: :KwaZulu-Natal also referred to as KZN or Natal and known as “the garden province” is a province of South Africa that was created in 1994 when the  Zulu Bantustan  of  KwaZulu and Natal Province were merged.

Questions: Moscow surname is ………………………………….
solution: :White-stone nickname was given to highlight the architectural image of medieval Moscow built of white stone including the Kremlin wall of the XIV century.

Questions: The Lion City is nickname of which country ?
solution: :The lion head represents Singapore’s original name—Singapura—meaning “lion city” or “kota singa”.

Questions: City of Four Rivers is surname of ……………………
solution: :Turin is located in Northwest Italy. Four major rivers pass through the city: the Po and three of its tributaries, the Dora Riparia ,the Stura di Lanzo and the Sangone.

Questions: Milano is also known as …………………………..
solution: :The Italian city of Milan is recognised internationally as one of the world’s most important fashion capitals, along with Paris, New York and London.

Questions: Which of the following is surname of Ushuaia  ?
solution: :“Ushuaiais the end of the world but beginning of everything

Questions: Kuala Lumpur is also known as ………………………………..
solution: :Kuala Lumpur’s commercial, shopping and entertainment hub, the Golden Triangle is actually a large area that encompasses a number of major streets. Three roads – Jalan Imbi, Jalan Sultan Ismail and Jalan Raja Chulan form a triangle which borders the entire Golden Triangle area

Questions: Which two countries are linked through an underground tunnel ?
solution: :France and England are linked through an underground tunnel

Questions: In which country is agriculture practised on the highest percentage of land ?
solution: :Agriculture is a vital industry in China, employing over 300 million farmers.China ranks first in worldwide farm output, primarily producing rice, wheat, potatoes, tomato, sorghum, peanuts, tea, millet, barley, cotton, oilseed and soybeans.

Questions: Main fishing grounds are found in the …………………….
solution: :The major commercial fishing grounds are located in the cool waters of the northern hemisphere

Questions: The wettest continent of the world is …………….
solution: :South America is the wettest continent in the world.The dense rain forests that cover almost half the continent contributes to this.

Questions: The largest sweet water lake in the world is ………………
solution: :Lake Superior is the largest freshwater lake in the world in area (if Lakes Michigan andHuron are taken separately; see Lake Michigan–Huron), and the third largest in volume, behind Lake Baikal in Siberia andLake Tanganyika in East Africa

Questions: Yosemite is a …………………………………
solution: :Yosemite Falls is the highest waterfall in Yosemite National Park, dropping a total of 2,425 feet (739 m) from the top of the upper fall to the base of the lower fall.

Questions: The Mariana Trench is located in ………………..
solution: :The Mariana Trench or Marianas Trenchis the deepest part of the world’s oceans. It is located in the western Pacific Ocean, to the east of the Mariana Islands. The trench is about 2,550 kilometres (1,580 mi) long but has an average width of only 69 kilometres (43 mi)

Questions: ………………… is the name of Indo-Chinese border
solution: :The McMahon Line is a line agreed to by Britain and Tibet as part of the Simla Accord, a treaty signed in 1914 . It is the effective boundary between China and India, although its legal status is disputed by the Chinese government.

Questions: Which country was formerly known as Rhodesia ?
solution: :Zimbabwe Rhodesia was an unrecognised state that existed from 1 June 1979 to 12 December 1979. Zimbabwe Rhodesia was preceded by an unrecognised republic named Rhodesia and was briefly followed by the re'clear Lock' -e 'keycode 0x42 = Escape'stablished British colony of Southern Rhodesia.

Questions: The Radcliffe line is a boundary demarcation line between  which two countries ?
solution: :The Radcliffe Line was published on 17 August 1947 as a boundary demarcation line between India and Pakistan upon the Partition of India

Questions: Which of the line is presently not in use ?
solution: :17th Parallel defined the boundary between North Vietnam and South Vietnam before two were united.

Questions: Maginot line is placed between …………………..
solution: :The Maginot Line was a vast fortification that spread along the French/German border but became a military liability when the Germans attacked France in the II world war

Questions: ………………. Is between USA and Canada
solution: :49th Parallel is the boundary between USA and Canada.

Questions: Which of the following line is placed between India and China ?
solution: :Macmahon Line was drawn up by Sir Henry MacMahon, demarcating the frontier of India and China. China did not recognize the MacMahon line and crossed it in 1962 .

Questions: 38th Parallel line is separate ………………… and …………………
solution: :38th Parallel is the parallel of latitude which separates North Korea and South Korea.

Questions: Which line is the boundary between India and Pakistan ?
solution: :24th Parallel is the line which Pakistan claims for demarcation between India and Pakistan. This, however, is not recognized by India

Questions: ………………. Is placed between Pakistan and Afghanistan
solution: :Durand Line is the line demarcating the boundaries of Pakistan and Afghanistan. It was drawn up in 1896 by Sir Mortimer Durand.

Questions: Siegfried line is placed between …………….. and ………………….
solution: :The original Siegfried Line (German: Siegfriedstellung) was a First World War line of defensive forts and tank defences built by Germany in northern France.

Questions: Which line is place between Germany and Poland ?
solution: :Hindenburg Line is the boundary dividing Germany and Poland. The Germans retreated to this line in 1917 during World War I

Questions: Who was the first person to calculate the circumference of the Earth ?
solution: :Eratosthenes is best known for being the first person to calculate the circumference of the Earth, which he did by applying a measuring system using stadia.

Questions: ………………. is the outermost and the thinnest layer of the Earth
solution: :The Earth can be divided into four main layers: the solid crust on the outside, the mantle, the outer core and the inner core. The crust, the outermost layer or surface layer, is the thinnest layer of Earth

Questions: …………….. are the changed form of Igneous and Sedimentary rocks
solution: :Igneous rock can change into sedimentary rock or into metamorphic rock by metamorphic process

Questions: The Ocean current flowing from lower altitude to higher altitude are called as
solution: :The Ocean current flowing from lower altitude to higher altitude are called as Warm current

Questions: The Ocean current flowing from higher altitude to lower altitude are called as
solution: :The Ocean current flowing from higher altitude to lower altitude are called as Cold current

Questions: Which rocks are formed due to the cooling solidification and crystallisation of hot and molten magma ?
solution: :Igneous Rocks are formed by crystallization from a liquid, or magma. They include two types. Volcanic or extrusive igneous rocks and intrusive rocks

Questions: The Rocks are made up of ……………..
solution: :The crust is made up of rocks and minerals. Much of the crust is covered by water, sand, soil and ice.

Questions: The intermediate layer of the Earth is called as …………..
solution: :The mantle is a layer between the crust and the outer core. Earth’s mantle is a silicate rocky shell with an average thickness of 2,886 kilometres (1,793 mi).

Questions: ……………. is the study of soils in their natural environment
solution: :Pedology is the study of soils in their natural environment. It is one of two main branches of soil science, the other being edaphology

Questions: Who among the following created the first map of the world ?
solution: :Anaximander invented the idea of models, drew the first map of the world in Greece, and is said to have been the first to write a book of prose.

Questions: Which is the first Indian product to get the geographical indication tag ?
solution: :Darjeeling Tea was the first Indian product to get the geographical indication tag. In 2004, the famous beverage got the recognition.

Questions: Muga silk is the product from which state ?
solution: :Muga silk is the product of the silkworm Antheraea assamensis endemic to Assam. The larvae of these moths feed on som (Machilus bombycinA) and sualu (Litsaea polyanthA) leaves.

Questions: Himsagar is an extremely popular mango cultivar, originating from _________________
solution: :Himsagar is an extremely popular mango cultivar, originating from West Bengal in India and Rajshahi in Bangladesh.

Questions: Phulkari is a rural tradition art of crafting embroidered method used in which state ?
solution: :Phulkari is a rural tradition art of crafting embroidered odhni(head drape or shawl) used by women in Punjab, literally meaning” flower work “, linked integrally with events considered to bemilestones in a womans life.

Questions: Pokkali is a unique saline tolerant rice variety that is cultivated in ________________
solution: :Pokkali is a unique saline tolerant rice variety that is cultivated in an organic way in the water-logged coastal regions, spread in about 5000 hectares area in Alappuzha, Thrissur and Ernakulam districts of Kerala in Southern India

Questions: Kullu Shawl is the product of which state of India ?
solution: :After Kullu Shawl, Kangra Tea and Chamba Rumal, Kinnauri Shawl has become the fourth traditional product of Himachal Pradesh to get registered under Geographical Indications of Goods Act, 1999.

Questions: Feni is a spirit produced exclusively in ________________
solution: :Feni is a spirit produced exclusively in Goa, India. There are two types of feni; cashew feni and toddy palm feni, depending on the original ingredient.

Questions: The Puneri Pagadi is a turban, related with which state of India ?
solution: :The Puneri Pagadi is a turban, which is considered as a symbol of pride and honour in the city of Pune.

Questions: Naga Mircha is related with ____________
solution: :Nagaland is believed to be the original home of this chilli pepper and  it is known as the Naga Mircha or Raja Mircha – meaning “King of Chillies”

Questions: Which state is also known as the land of stunning stone sculptures ?
solution: :Odisha is the land of stunning stone sculptures. Stone craftsmen here have carved awesome sculptures since time immemorial. This is seen in the glorious Kalingan architecture of our temples, superb Buddhist heritage sites and also as individual sculptures which are revered around the world.
